meta.name: Night of Vespers Campaign Expansion
meta.description: The Night of Vespers campaign was inspired by Thomas De Quincy’s Suspiria De Profundis, Giallo cinema, Dario Argento’s Le Tri Madri film trilogy, and Miskatonic River Press’s Our Ladies of Sorrow Call of Cthulhu campaign by Kevin Ross. The investigator expansion containins 5 investigators and 126 unique player cards, including 13 Specialist cards.
meta.author: Exhaled Innards (aughhhh)

cards.name: The End of Seasons
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –1. If you fail, take 1 damage or 1 horror.
[cultist]: –1. If this token was drawn while taking an investigation test, draw another token.
[tablet]: –2. If you fail, lose 1 resource.
[elder_thing]: –3. If you fail, resolve the hunter keyword on the enemy closest to you.

cards.name: The End of Seasons
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –1. If you fail, take 1 direct damage or 1 direct horror.
[cultist]: –2. If this token was drawn while taking an investigation test, that test fails. Lose all remaining actions and end your turn.
[tablet]: –4. Lose 1 action and 1 resource.
[elder_thing]: –5. Resolve the hunter keyword on the enemy closest to you. If an enemy engages you due to this effect, it attacks you.

cards.flavor:
As the hour of your mysterious dinner companion's arrival draws near, you find yourself in need of a distraction. While the Trattoria del Parche's much-acclaimed floor show offers a modest reprieve from your growing boredom and anxiety, the complementary bottle of wine at your table has been a much more direct way to help ease the passage of time. 
You sneak a glance at the clock. Surely you can't be expected to wait for much longer, can you?
cards.name: Too Swift Arrives...
cards.text: Forced - Investigators cannot leave Trattoria del Parche.

cards.name: ...As Tardy as Too Slow
cards.text:
The clock ticks on. You've nibbled through the contents of your bread basket, and while that's helped to fend off a little of the awkward feeling of waiting alone at your table, your attention remains fixed on the restaurant's entrance. You're still holding out hope that your elusive dinner companion will walk in any second now. Instead, you witness a line of trenchcoat-clad men march through the doorway, forming an ominous blockade across the front of the establishment. Against the commotion of the floor show, their arrival goes largely unnoticed. None of the other diners seem to register the moment when the men draw their firearms from beneath their coats, or when they aim squarely at the O'Bannion party. You see this all unfold before anyone else does. The grim realization of what is about to happen is yours alone. You have just enough time to flip over your table.
FlipTrattoria del Parche: La Dolce Vita over to its La Brutta Vita side. Advance to Act 1b.

cards.flavor: Screams echo throughout the Hotel Seasons. You keep your head low and prepare to bolt at the first sign of a lull in the gunfire.
cards.name: Open Season
cards.text: Forced - When an encounter card requires you to look for the "nearest" or "furthest" location from you, treat all location connections as if they are two-way instead of one-way. Forced - As an additional cost to move into any unrevealed location, investigators must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.

cards.name: No Safe Passage
cards.text:
You continue your tumultuous flight through the hotel corridors, but you skid to a sudden stop when you hear the sound of angry voices from around the corner. Slipping past them unnoticed will take some luck.
In player order, each investigator must test [agility] (3). Any investigator that fails this test must search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Syndicate]] enemy and spawn it at a connecting location. If you cannot, move the nearest [[Syndicate]] enemy to your location. It makes an immediate attack against you.

cards.flavor: Time has become your enemy. The hatchetmen on your tail are growing closer with each passing moment.
cards.name: Calling It a Night
cards.text: Forced - When an encounter card requires you to look for the "nearest" or "furthest" location from you, treat all location connections as if they are two-way instead of one-way. Forced - As an additional cost to move into any unrevealed location, investigators must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.

cards.name: Packing It In
cards.text:
"Over there!" barks a gruff voice from behind you, followed swiftly by a din of gunfire. You've been made!
Each remaining investigator is defeated.

cards.flavor:
You can't help but steal another glance back at the table of O'Bannion men you noticed when you first entered the restaurant. The grande dame at the far end of the table departs to powder her nose, but not before leaning down to give the elderly gent at the head of the table a gentle kiss on the cheek.
Isn't it nice to see that romance is alive and well, even in these curious times?
cards.name: Thus, With a Kiss
cards.text: Objective - Try to enjoy the evening. You deserve it. (You will be instructed when to advance.)

cards.name: Parting Is Such Sweet Sorrow
cards.text:
The unmistakable staccato sound of gunfire erupts over your head as the restaurant descends into chaos. Glass explodes into shards around you. Stray bullets reduce the once-luxurious decor to shreds. From behind the safety of your upturned table, you can see the remnants of the O'Bannion party strewn about the floor. From what you can tell, most of them didn't even have time to react before they were gunned down in cold blood. Amidst the screams of the terrified dancers onstage, you can hear one of the hatchetmen issue a single, gruff command: "No witnesses." Your night out has been cancelled. It's time for you to go.
Put the Trattoria Kitchens and Bar L'Ammaliatrice into play, face-down. Advance to Act 2a.

cards.flavor: A stray bullet ricochets into a porcelain vase just behind your head, shattering it into pieces. Unless you intend to finish out your evening in the back of a hearse, you need to get out of this restaurant, fast.
cards.name: A Family Affair
cards.text: Forced - After you move to a new location: Set each unrevealed location in play aside, out of play. Objective - If each undefeated investigator is in the Grand Ballroom, they may spend the requisite number of clues as a group to advance.

cards.name: Out of the Frying Pan
cards.text:
The Grand Ballroom is eerily silent amidst the chaos. Recognition strikes once you inspect the savaged corpse that has been propped up against the grand piano. The elderly gentleman who had been seated at the head of the O'Bannion's table now gapes up vacantly at you, his eyes gouged from their sockets and his face slashed into ribbons. If you hadn't seen him alive and well earlier tonight, you'd swear he'd been dead for weeks. Your line of thought is interrupted as the ballroom's curtains suddenly ignite, and the room erupts into flame. Panicked, you shield your eyes and stagger away from the old man's body. You push through a pair of ornate double doors, ready to resume your escape---and find yourself in back in the Tratorria del Parche's dining hall. With dismay, you realize that all you've accomplished after your terrified flight through the hotel is a single loop through the estate. There is a groan behind you. You take a glance backward into the fiery ballroom, only to see the old man's corpse rise achingly to its feet, like something out of a nightmare. The wordless hiss it makes when it notices you watching is all the encouragement you need to resume running.
Discard all enemies from play that are not currently engaged with an investigator. Move each investigator to Trattoria del Parche and return the remaining set-aside location connected to Trattoria del Parche to play, unrevealed (Bar L'Ammaliatrice or Trattoria Kitchens). Remove each revealed location other than Trattoria del Parche from the game, placing any locations with Victory X that have been cleared of clues in the victory display. Refill clues on Trattoria del Parche to its maximum clue value. Spawn the set-aside Declan O'Doyle enemy at Trattoria del Parche, exhausted. Then, shuffle the set-aside Inferno encounter set into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile. Advance to Act 3a.

cards.flavor: All this running, and you've only managed to wind your way back to where you began. With the hotel ablaze, your only hope now to survive the evening unscathed is to cut a path through the flames to an exit---any exit.
cards.name: Into the Fire
cards.text: Forced - After you move to a new location: Remove each unrevealed location in play from the game. Jinx -- You must either place 1 clue on your location from the token bank or ready the nearest exhausted enemy. Objective - If each undefeated investigator is at the Conservatory, Hedge Maze, or Hotel Rooftop, they may spend the requisite number of clues as a group to advance.

cards.name: The Escape from the Hotel Seasons
cards.text:
If the act advanced at the Conservatory:
With the fire spreading quickly and the old man's corpse in relentless pursuit, there's nowhere left for you to run---not unless you make your own escape route. With all your might, you fling a nearby chair through the conservatory's glass window, and follow soon after into the night as the glass crashes down around you.
Add 1 [tablet] to the chaos bag for the remainder of the campaign. →R1.
If the act advanced at the Hedge Maze:
You can hear the terrible sounds of several of your fellow guests's final moments as you navigate the maze, separated from you by only a few feet of juniper. Your own demise seems like a frightening certainty, but as you turn one final corner, the hotel's driveway comes into view. You summon every last bit of your remaining strength and bolt toward the opening as fast as you can.
Add 1 [cultist] to the chaos bag for the remainder of the campaign. →R1.
If the act advanced at the Hotel Rooftop:
The wind on the rooftop bites at your face. Looking down, you gauge the distance to the ground below---a sizable drop, but survivable if the hedges below cushion your fall. It's not a perfect plan, but you lose the opportunity to consider any alternatives when the old man's relentless corpse emerges onto the rooftop behind you. Down has become your only viable path. You swallow your courage---and leap.
Add 1 [elder_thing] to the chaos bag for the remainder of the campaign. →R1.

cards.flavor:
You did make sure to wear your nicest outfit, 
but somehow, you still feel underdressed.
cards.name: Trattoria del Parche
cards.text:
The first card played during each investigator's turn at Trattoria del Parche costs –1 resource.
[action]: Search the top 9 cards of your deck for a card of your choice and draw it. Shuffle your deck. (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
As much as you loathe the idea of dining and dashing, 
good manners won't win you any favors if you're dead.
cards.name: Trattoria del Parche
cards.text: As an additional cost to move out of Trattoria del Parche, test [agility] (2). If you fail, you must either cancel the effects of the move or take 1 damage. Forced - At the end of the round, each investigator at Trattoria del Parche takes 1 direct damage and 1 direct horror.

cards.flavor:
If you cut through the garden outside the conservatory, 
you might be able to put some distance between 
you and your pursuers. The door is locked tight, 
but it'd be a simple thing to bring the wall of glass down...
cards.name: Conservatory
cards.text: [action] If there are no clues remaining on the Conservatory: Test [combat] (3). If you succeed, remember that you "threw a chair through the conservatory window."

cards.flavor:
The Hotel Seasons' glamorous lantern-style conservatory 
houses exotic plants from across the world, and is equipped 
with a stylish modern lounge for social gatherings.
cards.name: Conservatory
cards.text: Forced - After you move into Conservatory, put each of the following locations that have not been removed from the game or placed in the victory display into play, unrevealed: - Grand Ballroom

cards.flavor: You can see down into the hotel ballroom through a half-open skylights. You're also acutely aware of the long drop to the ground below if you take one wrong step.
cards.name: Hotel Rooftop
cards.text: [action] If there are no clues remaining on the Hotel Rooftop: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, remember that you "forced open the rooftop skylight."

cards.flavor: The panoramic view of the city as seen from atop French Hill is one of the Hotel Seasons' most stunning features, allowing visitors to take in Arkham's breathtaking skyline in all its splendor.
cards.name: Hotel Rooftop
cards.text: Forced - After you move into Hotel Rooftop, put each of the following locations that have not been removed from the game or placed in the victory display into play, unrevealed: - Grand Ballroom

cards.flavor:
You catch sight of your assailants a few hedgerows over, struggling to navigate the labyrinth.
Unfortunately, you're just as lost as they are.
cards.name: Hedge Maze
cards.text: [action] If there are no clues remaining on the Hedge Maze: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, remember that you "found a way through the hedge maze."

cards.flavor:
A delight for children and adults alike, the Hotel Seasons' 
juniper hedge maze is a surefire way to fill an 
evening with whimsical fun for the whole family.
cards.name: Hedge Maze
cards.text: Forced - After you move into Hedge Maze, put each of the following locations that have not been removed from the game or placed in the victory display into play, unrevealed: - Grand Ballroom

cards.flavor: A body lies sprawled out in a ghoulish position across the ballroom's grand piano. As grotesque as the sight is, something about it compels you to investigate further...
cards.name: Grand Ballroom
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal Grand Ballroom: Resolve the hunter keyword on each enemy in play. This location gets –1 shroud for each enemy with the hunter keyword in play.

cards.flavor: Spend a night rubbing elbows with New England's social elite on the ballroom floor, and you won't possibly be able to resist the hotel's sophisticated allure.
cards.name: Grand Ballroom
cards.text:
Investigators cannot enter the Grand Ballroom unless one of the following is true:-<hsp> An investigator "threw a chair through the conservatory <hsp><hsp>window."
-<hsp> An investigator "found a way through the hedge maze."
-<hsp> An investigator "forced open the rooftop skylight."

cards.flavor: The bartender is hunched down behind the countertop, pressing a flimsy rag against a minor bullet wound on his neck. He locks eyes with you and mouths a single word: "Run!"
cards.name: Bar L'Ammaliatrice
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal Bar L'Ammaliatrice: Choose and discard a card from your hand. Then, draw the top card of your deck. [action]: Heal 1 horror.

cards.flavor:
Bar L'Ammaliatrice offers a staggering catalog of more than 
60 distinct varieties of alcohol. That such a thing is allowed to exist in 
Arkham during Prohibition is nothing short of mind-boggling; 
the fact that the city police haven't shut it down is a veritable miracle.
cards.name: Bar L'Ammaliatrice
cards.text: Forced - After you move into Bar L'Ammaliatrice, put each of the following locations that have not been removed from the game or placed in the victory display into play, unrevealed: - Galerie Lavandière - Mezzanine Elevators

cards.flavor: The bartender is hunched down behind the countertop, pressing a flimsy rag against a minor bullet wound on his neck. He locks eyes with you and mouths a single word: "Run!"
cards.name: Bar L'Ammaliatrice
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal Bar L'Ammaliatrice: Take 1 horror. [action]: Investigate. This test uses [agility] instead of [intellect].

cards.flavor:
Bar L'Ammaliatrice offers a staggering catalog of more than 
60 distinct varieties of alcohol. That such a thing is allowed to exist in 
Arkham during Prohibition is nothing short of mind-boggling; 
the fact that the city police haven't shut it down is a veritable miracle.
cards.name: Bar L'Ammaliatrice
cards.text: Forced - After you move into Bar L'Ammaliatrice, put each of the following locations that have not been removed from the game or placed in the victory display into play, unrevealed: - Galerie Lavandière - Mezzanine Elevators

cards.flavor:
There's no time to stop and appreciate the pleasant, 
visually unambiguous artwork---you can hear the 
shouting of angry voices in the next room over!
cards.name: Galerie Lavandière
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal Galerie Lavandière: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is revealed. Then, spawn that enemy at a connecting unrevealed location.

cards.flavor: The Hotel Seasons' tasteful fine art gallery currently showcases a collection of work by the masters of the Renaissance. There's no room here for that baffling cubist nonsense that seems to have taken the world by storm.
cards.name: Galerie Lavandière
cards.text: Forced - After you move into Galerie Lavandière, put each of the following locations that have not been removed from the game or placed in the victory display into play, unrevealed: - Hotel Lobby- Luxury Suites

shouting of angry voices in the next room over!
cards.name: Galerie Lavandière
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal Galerie Lavandière: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is revealed. Then, spawn that enemy at Trattoria Kitchens or Bar L'Ammaliatrice.

cards.flavor: The Hotel Seasons' tasteful fine art gallery currently showcases a collection of work by the masters of the Renaissance. There's no room here for that baffling cubist nonsense that seems to have taken the world by storm.
cards.name: Galerie Lavandière
cards.text: Forced - After you move into Galerie Lavandière, put each of the following locations that have not been removed from the game or placed in the victory display into play, unrevealed: - Hotel Lobby- Luxury Suites

cards.flavor:
The pervasive scent mixed in with the tomato sauce and wine was, in fact, the smell of something burning. In the chaos,
 a small grease fire has broken out on one of the stovetops.
cards.name: Trattoria Kitchens
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal Trattoria Kitchens: Test [agility] (2). This test gets +X difficulty, where X is the current Act. If you succeed, each investigator at your location may draw a card. [action]: Heal 1 damage.

cards.flavor:
The Trattoria del Parche kitchens exude a heady aroma 
of red wine and tomato sauce. There's another rich smell, as well; something that you can't quite place.
cards.name: Trattoria Kitchens
cards.text: Forced - After you move into Trattoria Kitchens, put each of the following locations that have not been removed from the game or placed in the victory display into play, unrevealed: - Galerie Lavandière - Hotel Wine Cellar

cards.text: Forced - When you reveal Trattoria Kitchens: Take 1 damage. [action]: Search the top 9 cards of your deck for a [[Supply]] card and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck. (Limit once per investigator.)

cards.flavor:
The Trattoria del Parche kitchens exude a heady aroma 
of red wine and tomato sauce. There's another rich smell, as well; something that you can't quite place.
cards.name: Trattoria Kitchens
cards.text: Forced - After you move into Trattoria Kitchens, put each of the following locations that have not been removed from the game or placed in the victory display into play, unrevealed: - Galerie Lavandière - Hotel Wine Cellar

cards.flavor:
The shouting behind you is growing louder, closer. 
Thankfully, there's a lot of furniture to hide behind.
cards.name: Hotel Lobby
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal Hotel Lobby: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[Syndicate]] enemy is revealed. Then, spawn that enemy at Trattoria del Parche. [action]: Evade. You may choose to evade an enemy at the Wine Cellar or Galerie Lavandière instead of an enemy at this location. If you do, this test gets +1 difficulty.

cards.flavor: No expense has been spared in providing the most lavish experience for Hotel Seasons' patrons, with a gorgeous lobby designed in the contemporary arts décoratifs style in stunning shades of gold and scarlet.
cards.name: Hotel Lobby
cards.text: Forced - After you move into Hotel Lobby, put each of the following locations that have not been removed from the game or placed in the victory display into play, unrevealed: - Hedge Maze- Conservatory

cards.flavor:
The shouting behind you is growing louder, closer. 
Thankfully, there's a lot of furniture to hide behind.
cards.name: Hotel Lobby
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal Hotel Lobby: Draw the topmost [[Hazard]] treachery from the encounter discard pile. You get +2 to fight and evade actions while in the Hotel Lobby.

cards.flavor: No expense has been spared in providing the most lavish experience for Hotel Seasons' patrons, with a gorgeous lobby designed in the contemporary arts décoratifs style in stunning shades of gold and scarlet.
cards.name: Hotel Lobby
cards.text: Forced - After you move into Hotel Lobby, put each of the following locations that have not been removed from the game or placed in the victory display into play, unrevealed: - Hedge Maze- Conservatory

cards.flavor: Navigating these hallways is an exercise in frustration, as you maneuver through an endless series of locked doors and dead ends. How many broom closets does one hotel need?
cards.name: Luxury Suites
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal Luxury Suites: Reveal the top card of the encounter deck. If that card would spawn at or attach to a location, spawn it at Luxury Suites instead.

cards.flavor:
A stay in any of the hotel's 60 luxury guest suites ought to 
tempt even the most jaded cosmopolitan traveller.
cards.name: Luxury Suites
cards.text: Forced - After you move into Luxury Suites, put each of the following locations that have not been removed from the game or placed in the victory display into play, unrevealed: - Conservatory- Hotel Rooftop

cards.text: Forced - When you reveal Luxury Suites: Until the end of the round, all [intellect] and [willpower] tests get +2 difficulty. [free] Spend 3 resources: Discard a non-weakness treachery in your threat area. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
A stay in any of the hotel's 60 luxury guest suites ought to 
tempt even the most jaded cosmopolitan traveller.
cards.name: Luxury Suites
cards.text: Forced - After you move into Luxury Suites, put each of the following locations that have not been removed from the game or placed in the victory display into play, unrevealed: - Conservatory- Hotel Rooftop

cards.flavor:
One of the elevators is slowly descending to your floor, and you have 
only a moment to prepare for whatever---or whoever---is inside.
cards.name: Mezzanine Elevators
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal Mezzanine Elevators: Draw a random token from the chaos bag. If you drew...- ...a [elder_sign], +1, 0, or [bless], you may immediately take an action as if it were your turn (this action does not count toward the number of actions you can take each turn). - ...any other token, take 1 damage.

cards.flavor:
The mezzanine's elevators are true works of art, featuring 
ornate design elements in polished brass and marble.
cards.name: Mezzanine Elevators
cards.text: Forced - After you move into Mezzanine Elevators, put each of the following locations that have not been removed from the game or placed in the victory display into play, unrevealed: - Luxury Suites- Presidential Suite

cards.flavor:
One of the elevators is slowly descending to your floor, and you have 
only a moment to prepare for whatever---or whoever---is inside.
cards.name: Mezzanine Elevators
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal Mezzanine Elevators: Randomly discard 1 card from your hand. If that card was...- ...an asset, you may return a different card from your discard pile to your hand. - ...an event, you may search the top 3 cards of your deck for a different event card and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck. - ...a skill card, gain an amount of resources equal to the number of skill icons on that card.

cards.flavor:
The mezzanine's elevators are true works of art, featuring 
ornate design elements in polished brass and marble.
cards.name: Mezzanine Elevators
cards.text: Forced - After you move into Mezzanine Elevators, put each of the following locations that have not been removed from the game or placed in the victory display into play, unrevealed: - Luxury Suites- Presidential Suite

cards.flavor:
You briefly consider making a break for the garden walls, but they're much too high to scale. You probably 
shouldn't linger out here in the open for long.
cards.name: Pleasure Gardens
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal Pleasure Gardens: Test [willpower] or [agility] (3). If you fail, discard an asset under your control.

cards.flavor: The Hotel Seasons' classical English pleasure garden offers a retreat from the rigors of daily life---a haven for leisurely strolls, peaceful contemplation, or simply unwinding amidst the timeless beauty of the outdoors.
cards.name: Pleasure Gardens
cards.text: Forced - After you move into Pleasure Gardens, put each of the following locations that have not been removed from the game or placed in the victory display into play, unrevealed: - Hedge Maze - Hotel Rooftop

cards.text: Forced - When you reveal Pleasure Gardens: Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, you must place 1 of your clues on your location or take 1 damage.

cards.flavor: Up the stairs of the master suite, and out an open window---but what then? Have you thought this route through?
cards.name: Presidential Suite
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal Presidential Suite: Test [agility] (4). If you succeed, gain 1 resource and draw a card. If you fail, lose 1 action.

cards.flavor: The two-level presidential suite boasts a spacious downstairs living area, while upstairs a master bedroom fit for royalty awaits.
cards.name: Presidential Suite
cards.text: Forced - After you move into Presidential Suite, put each of the following locations that have not been removed from the game or placed in the victory display into play, unrevealed: - Hotel Rooftop - Hedge Maze

but what then? Have you thought this route through?

If they fail, that investigator must place an equal number of their clues to the amount they failed by on this location. If they cannot, they must take 1 direct damage and horror. [action]: Gain 5 resources. (Limit once per game.)

cards.name: Presidential Suite
cards.text: Forced - After you move into Presidential Suite, put each of the following locations that have not been removed from the game or placed in the victory display into play, unrevealed: - Hotel Rooftop - Hedge Maze

cards.flavor: The wine cellar is quiet and poorly lit. Any manner of thing could be hiding behind the racks, lying in wait for you.
cards.name: Hotel Wine Cellar
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal Hotel Wine Cellar: Each investigator may choose to take 1 horror. Each investigator that does so may return a card from their discard pile to their hand.

cards.flavor:
For those seeking an unforgettable tasting experience, the 
Hotel Seasons' experienced sommelier stands ready to guide guests through the cellar's treasure trove of rare vintages.
cards.name: Hotel Wine Cellar
cards.text: Forced - After you move into Hotel Wine Cellar, put each of the following locations that have not been removed from the game or placed in the victory display into play, unrevealed: - Hotel Lobby- Pleasure Gardens

cards.name: Declan O'Doyle
cards.text: Hunter. Retaliate. Jinxed. Declan O'Doyle gets +1 [per_investigator] health. Forced - If Declan O'Doyle would be defeated: Set his health to 1 [per_investigator] and exhaust him, instead. Declan O'Doyle does not ready during the next upkeep phase.

cards.flavor: "Payback's the only thing I care about."
cards.name: Finlay O'Doyle
cards.text:
You get +1 [combat].
[reaction] After you defeat an enemy, search the top 3 cards of your deck for a card and draw it. Shuffle your deck. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: "Brains are an asset, if you can hide 'em."
cards.name: Gigi Giuliano
cards.text:
You get +1 [agility].
[reaction] When you would take a [willpower] test on a treachery card, exhaust Gigi Giuliano: Reduce the difficulty of that test by 2. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: In Hot Pursuit
cards.text: Revelation - Resolve the hunter keyword on each enemy in play. If no enemies move as a result of this effect, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded and spawn that enemy at Trattoria del Parche.

cards.flavor: Maybe you won't go this way after all.
cards.name: Second Thoughts
cards.text: Revelation - Put Second Thoughts into play next to the Agenda deck. As an additional cost for an investigator to play a card from their hand or take a move action, they must spend 1 action. [action][action]: Discard Second Thoughts.

cards.name: Skulking Hooligan
cards.text: Spawn - Furthest revealed location from all investigators. Hunter. Forced - When Skulking Hooligan engages you, you must decide (choose one): - Return half of your total clues to the token bank (rounded up) and refill your location's clues to its maximum clue value. - Put 1 doom on the agenda. This doom may cause the agenda to advance.

cards.name: Behind Closed Doors
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: Reveal another token. If you succeed, exhaust Miss Lila Starett.
[cultist]: –1. If you fail, your location gains the jinxed keyword until the end of the round.
[tablet]: –2. If this test fails, move Miss Lila Starett 1 location closer to you.
[elder_thing]: –X. X is the shroud of your current location.

cards.name: Behind Closed Doors
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –1. Reveal another token.
[cultist]: –2. Your location gains the jinxed keyword until the end of the round.
[tablet]: –4. If this test fails, move Miss Lila Starett 1 location closer to you.
[elder_thing]: –X. X is one more than the shroud of your current location.

cards.flavor: You've heard local gossip about the Three Conies for as long as you can remember. Strange occurrences have been reported in its halls ever since it was built atop the ashes of Elizabeth Salmon's razed inn, some time after she was hanged for witchcraft back in the 1840s. You can't help but wonder how the story that's unfolding now will compare.
cards.name: The Haunting at the Three Conies
cards.text: Forced - When this agenda advances: Move all doom on it to the next agenda.

cards.name: The Shadow of Death
cards.text:
Despite your efforts, your progress has been slow, and the information you've gathered is too sparse to shed light on the events unfolding within the walls of the Three Conies. Unfortunately for you, it seems that Fate has conspired to intervene---to reveal the harrowing truth behind this terrible evening.
Reveal each face-down card attached to an [[Apartment]] location. If Act 1a is the current act, remove each Crime Scene story asset not in the victory display from the game. Add 1 [cultist] to the chaos bag for the remainder of the campaign. Each investigator takes 1 horror. Shuffle the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck. Advance the act.

cards.flavor:
Whenever an occupant vanished from the Three Conies, whispers of foul play would ripple through Arkham. After all, no respectable person would dare lodge in such a place. 
But now, you have to wonder: how many of these lost souls had fallen prey to the unspeakable thing lurking within its walls?
cards.name: The Strange Vice of Elizabeth Salmon
cards.text: Forced - The Hag cannot be damaged unless she is at The Third Floor. Jinx -- Test [agility] (3). If you fail, lose 1 action.

cards.name: The Bloodstained Shadow
cards.text:
Desperation drives you through the building's winding halls. The building groans under the weight of its own decay, and one false step sends you crashing through the brittle floorboards. Your head hits something hard on the way down, leaving you dazed. The Hag's chilling laughter echoes closer as you struggle to your feet. Dizzy and disoriented, you make a tough call: you flee before the terrible creature can sink her fangs into you.
Add 1 [cultist] to the chaos bag for the remainder of the campaign. Each remaining investigator is defeated.

cards.flavor: Chaos reignites in the aftermath of Madame Giuliano's departure, but the remaining tenants are gripped by a strange, haunting stillness---is there no way to break whatever terrible spell she has cast upon them?
cards.name: Collecting the Debt
cards.text: Jinx -- Test [agility] (3). If you fail, move Miss Lila Starett to your location. (Limit once per round.) Forced - If an effect would cause Ana Giuliano to leave The Third Floor: Cancel that effect and add 1 doom to the agenda, instead.

cards.name: The Bloodstained Butterfly
cards.text:
Panic takes hold of you as you navigate the labyrinth of the Three Conies, each step more frantic than the last. The building groans under the weight of its own decay, and one misstep sends you crashing through the brittle floorboards. Your head hits something hard on the way down, leaving you dazed. As you struggle to your feet from somewhere above, you hear Madame Giuliano's imperious, taunting laughter. Dizzy and disoriented, you make a tough call: you flee before you too are claimed by Madame Giuliano's fury.
Add 1 [elder_thing] to the chaos bag for the remainder of the campaign. Each remaining investigator is defeated.

cards.flavor:
Finlay has successfully smuggled you inside the Three Conies, and your search for the mysterious Madame Giuliano begins. The policemen out front were looking into a string of murders that took place in the building overnight; it might be that they're connected to your own investigation.
Maybe you'll even find something the police overlooked.
cards.name: Behind Closed Doors (v. I)
cards.text: Jinx -- Test [agility] (3). If you fail, resolve Miss Lila Starett's hunter keyword. Objective - If both Crime Scene cards are in the victory display: Advance.

cards.name: The Hag of Southside
cards.text:
A troubling picture emerges from the clues you've begun piecing together. The two slain men were O'Bannion associates, but the savaged, bloodied states of their rooms don't fit the bill for a typical mob hit. It's hard to imagine someone carrying out such brutal killings without alerting the other tenants. Suddenly, a horrified scream pierces the air, accompanied by a sickening crunch echoing down the corridor. You peer cautiously from behind the corner, and the ghastly sight freezes your blood in your veins. A grotesque figure that almost looks like an old woman looms over the mangled form of the building's landlady, Miss Lila. It looks up from its prey, fixes its multitude of beady eyes upon you, and darts down the hallway. It looks like you've found the murderer.
Put the set-aside The Hag enemy into play at the Third Floor. Remove Miss Lila Starett from the game. For the remainder of the scenario, whenever a scenario card refers to Miss Lila Starett: It refers to The Hag instead. Put this card next to the scenario reference card as a reminder. Reveal any remaining face-down cards attached to an [[Apartment]] location. Advance to Agenda 2a (do not resolve agenda 1b).

cards.flavor: An inhuman creature lurks within Three Conies, preying upon its unsuspecting tenants. How long has this abomination resided here, and why does it choose to act now? One thing is sure: if the other residents are not warned, they may soon share poor Miss Lila's grisly fate.
cards.name: The House of Shadows
cards.text: [free] If a [[Tenant]] asset at your location has at least 1 [per_investigator] clues on them: Parley. Move that asset to the victory display. The Three Conies Apartments gains "[action]: Resign." Objective - If all [[Tenant]] story assets have been removed from the game or are in the Victory Display: Advance.

cards.name: Cut and Run
cards.text:
With little prey left to feed upon, The Hag makes her escape. She skitters erratically down the corridor like a ricocheting bullet before crashing through the barricaded door to the third floor, shattering it into splinters. The path lies open if you dare to pursue her---assuming you're bold enough to take the risk.
Move The Hag to the Third Floor and reveal it.

cards.flavor: With no prey left to feed on, the creature has slunk back to her lair: the charred, crumbling remains of the building’s third floor. If you've got the guts, you might trap her there---but are you truly prepared for what she might do when backed into a corner?
cards.name: Beyond the Door
cards.text: Forced - If an effect would cause The Hag to leave The Third Floor: Cancel that effect and add 1 doom to the agenda, instead. The Three Conies Apartments gains "[action]: Resign." Objective - If The Hag is defeated: Advance.

cards.name: Tenebrarum
cards.text:
The Hag tumbles backward while shielding her face from your blows, cackling with mad glee. "For God's sake, why won't she go down?" Finlay yells in horrified frustration just before aiming his pistol and firing twice into her abdomen. With a mad howl, the creature tumbles backward from the impact, careening into the wall with a sickening thud.
→R1.

cards.flavor:
Gigi's horrified scream follows the sound of the landlady's gunshot. The smoking pistol slips from Miss Lila's fingers as her lifeless body hovers in midair, pulsing with a violent force that makes your eyes sting. What the hell is going on?
The sounds of gunfire and terrified screaming continue somewhere in the apartments above you. Something terrible is happening inside the Three Conies.
cards.name: Behind Closed Doors (v. II)
cards.text: Jinx -- Test [agility] (3). If you fail, move Miss Lila Starett to the copy of Tenement Corridors closest to you. Objective - Make sense of what is happening inside the Three Conies Apartments. At the end of the round, investigators may spend the requisite amount of clues as a group to advance.

cards.name: A Pure Formality
cards.text:
The atmosphere of chaos enveloping the Three Conies seems to freeze as you meet the gaze of Ana Giuliano, the elegant grande dame from that notorious night at the Hotel Seasons. She acknowledges Gigi with a fleeting look of disinterest before turning her full attention to you. "We finally meet face-to-face. I trust your recovery has been satisfactory?" She purrs dangerously as she sizes you up. "Unfortunately, your timing couldn't be more inconvenient. I'm here to collect on a debt owed by my sister, and there are matters to settle before I can take what's mine. Clearing the building of vermin, for instance." A distant gunshot from elsewhere in the apartments punctuates her ominous statement, and Madame Giuliano takes advantage of the brief distraction to slip away behind the dilapidated door to the third floor. "Find me upstairs when you grow tired of playing games, darling. I'll be waiting for you."
Reveal The Third Floor. Gather the set-aside Vivat Regina encounter set and put Ana Giuliano into play at the Third Floor with 2 resource tokens (from the token bank) on her as barrier tokens (3, if there are 3 or more investigators.) Reveal each unrevealed location in play, along with any cards attached to them. Then, attach 1 Binding Charm treachery to each [[Tenant]] asset. Shuffle each copy of Queenly Majesty into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile. Ana Giuliano's maximum barrier value is 2 (3, if there are 3 or more investigators.) Put this card next to the agenda deck as a reminder. Advance to Agenda 2c (do not resolve agenda 1b).

cards.flavor: Madame Giuliano's cryptic goal has become clear: she is orchestrating a dramatic purge of the Three Conies, with both her hired men and strange, unearthly forces at her beck and call. She is ready to receive you upstairs---if you are prepared for her.
cards.name: Deadly Inheritance
cards.text: Forced - Investigators cannot interact with Binding Charm treacheries in any way unless the [[Tenant]] story asset they are attached to has at least 1 [per_investigator] clues on them. Objective - If Ana Giuliano is defeated: Advance.

cards.name: Who Saw Her Die?
cards.text:
In spite of all the nightmarish horrors you'd witnessed this evening, Ana Giuliano's command of the eldritch arts still manages to catch you by surprise. She swiftly counters your attacks with an imperceptible barrier, and her own barrage of withering spells inflict searing pain on you and your companions. Yet, through sheer tenacity---or a stroke of luck---you manage to gradually wear down her defenses in an intense and grueling battle. With her back to the wall, Madame Giuliano starts to laugh---a soft, self-satisfied chuckle that swells, growing louder and louder until it transforms into the howling cackle of a madwoman.
→R3.

cards.flavor:
The building is named for the peculiar marble carving perched above its entryway: Three rabbits spinning 
in a wheel, so cleverly arranged that it appears each 
shares the same three ears. It's charming, you suppose, 
but you can't help but wonder what it means.
cards.name: Three Conies Apartments
cards.text: While you are at Three Conies Apartments, increase the cost of each card you play by 1.

cards.flavor:
Everybody knows the Three Conies tenement in Southside belongs to the O'Bannion gang. When the police had to poke their noses in to investigate the recent murders, 
they tried their best not to outstay their welcome. 
Maybe you'll stumble upon something they overlooked.
cards.name: Three Conies Apartments

cards.flavor:
This room is a quarter of the size of the building's 
other apartments at most. It's a wonder anyone 
has managed to eke out a life in here at all.
cards.name: Derelict Apartment
cards.text:
Increase the difficulty to parley at Derelict Apartment by 2.
[reaction] After you discover a clue at Derelict Apartment, you may exhaust a non-[[Elite]] enemy of your choice.

cards.flavor:
Behind this door lies one of the Three Conies' 
tiny apartments. In the wake of the recent murders, 
the building's residents have been reluctant 
to open their doors to strangers.
cards.name: East Apartment
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal this location, reveal all cards attached to it as well.

cards.flavor: A lingering aroma hangs in the air---a strange mixture of stale alcohol, sweat, and something else entirely.
cards.name: Musty Apartment
cards.text: Jinxed. Forced - When you would move out of Musty Apartment, test [willpower] (3). If you fail, lose 1 action.

cards.flavor:
Behind this door lies one of the Three Conies' 
tiny apartments. In the wake of the recent murders, 
the building's residents have been reluctant 
to open their doors to strangers.
cards.name: East Apartment
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal this location, reveal all cards attached to it as well.

cards.flavor:
Though this room is in far better shape 
than most of the Three Conies' Apartments, there's an eerie, disconcerting silence that fills the cluttered space.
cards.name: Quiet Apartment
cards.text:
As an additional cost to parley at Quiet Apartment, you must spend 1 additional action.
[reaction]When you succeed at an investigation at this location: Discover 1 additional clue. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
Behind this door lies one of the Three Conies' 
tiny apartments. In the wake of the recent murders, 
the building's residents have been reluctant 
to open their doors to strangers.
cards.name: East Apartment
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal this location, reveal all cards attached to it as well.

cards.flavor: This room hasn't been cleaned in months---maybe years---and you've already stepped in something wet.
cards.name: Filthy Apartment
cards.text: Move and evade actions cost 1 additional action at Filthy Apartment.

cards.flavor:
Behind this door lies one of the Three Conies' 
tiny apartments. In the wake of the recent murders, 
the building's residents have been reluctant 
to open their doors to strangers.
cards.name: West Apartment
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal this location, reveal all cards attached to it as well.

cards.flavor:
Soft beams of light trickle in through the curtains 
of this quaint little room. Sadly, once you 
remember everything else that's amiss at 
the Three Conies, the illusion of peace falters.
cards.name: Peaceful Apartment
cards.text: [action][action]: Heal 1 damage and 1 horror.

cards.flavor:
Behind this door lies one of the Three Conies' 
tiny apartments. In the wake of the recent murders, 
the building's residents have been reluctant 
to open their doors to strangers.
cards.name: West Apartment
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal this location, reveal all cards attached to it as well.

cards.flavor:
It's dark and miserable in this cold little room. 
You can't imagine its owner likes living here.
cards.name: Threadbare Apartment
cards.text:
Jinxed.
Actions that test [intellect] and/or [combat] get +2 difficulty while at Threadbare Apartment.

cards.flavor:
Behind this door lies one of the Three Conies' 
tiny apartments. In the wake of the recent murders, 
the building's residents have been reluctant 
to open their doors to strangers.
cards.name: West Apartment
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal this location, reveal all cards attached to it as well.

cards.flavor:
Bits of wallpaper flakes off of the wall as you enter the room, and the floorboards creak like they're about 
to crumble away underneath your weight.
cards.name: Decaying Apartment
cards.text: Forced - When you would move out of Decaying Apartment, test [agility] (3). If you fail, choose and discard a card from your hand.

cards.flavor:
Behind this door lies one of the Three Conies' 
tiny apartments. In the wake of the recent murders, 
the building's residents have been reluctant 
to open their doors to strangers.
cards.name: North Apartment
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal this location, reveal all cards attached to it as well.

cards.flavor: The more time you spend within its dingy confines, the more your irritability grows. It's almost as if the room has been purposefully designed to sap the joy out of you.
cards.name: Dreary Apartment
cards.text:
Jinxed.
Actions that test [willpower] and/or [agility] get +2 difficulty while at Dreary Apartment.

cards.flavor:
Behind this door lies one of the Three Conies' 
tiny apartments. In the wake of the recent murders, 
the building's residents have been reluctant 
to open their doors to strangers.
cards.name: North Apartment
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal this location, reveal all cards attached to it as well.

cards.flavor:
This cozy little apartment is a veritable museum of 
framed photographs and religious knick-knacks.
cards.name: Tidy Apartment
cards.text:
Parley actions automatically succeed while in Tidy Apartment.
As an additional cost to investigate Tidy Apartment, you must spend 1 additional action.

cards.flavor:
Behind this door lies one of the Three Conies' 
tiny apartments. In the wake of the recent murders, 
the building's residents have been reluctant 
to open their doors to strangers.
cards.name: North Apartment
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal this location, reveal all cards attached to it as well.

cards.flavor:
The sounds of soft, shuffling footsteps echo 
throughout the dimly lit corridors.
cards.name: Tenement Corridors
cards.text: [free] During your turn, choose and discard a card from your hand: Move to another copy of Tenement Corridors.

cards.flavor:
The hallways of the rundown apartment building 
are a tangled web of worn-out carpets, peeling 
wallpaper, and flickering lights that  
cast eerie shadows across the uneven floors.
cards.name: Tenement Corridors

throughout the dimly lit corridors.
