cards.flavor:
The hallways of the rundown apartment building 
are a tangled web of worn-out carpets, peeling 
wallpaper, and flickering lights that  
cast eerie shadows across the uneven floors.
cards.name: Tenement Corridors

cards.flavor:
All that remains of the third floor is a burnt mess of 
crumbling walls and waterlogged furniture, but someone---
or something---has been living here for some time.
cards.name: The Third Floor
cards.text: Jinxed. [action]: Investigate. This test gets +1 difficulty and tests [agility] instead of [intellect]. If you succeed, you may either discover a clue at this location, or exhaust a [[Witch]] enemy at any location.

cards.flavor:
A decade has passed since a terrible fire ravaged the 
Three Conies' third floor. What remains is kept off-limits from the rest of the building for safety reasons. 
Repairs have been slow.
cards.name: The Third Floor
cards.text: You cannot enter The Third Floor.

cards.flavor:
Miss Lila hobbles after you at a snail's pace, 
intent on slowing your investigation. Honestly,
 how hard can it be to shake one old woman?
cards.name: Miss Lila Starett
cards.text: Aloof. Hunter. Miss Lila Starett cannot attack or be defeated. Forced - If Miss Lila Starett is ready: Clues cannot be discovered at her location or at connecting [[Apartment]] locations. [reaction] If you succeed at a fight or evade action against Miss Lila Starett: Exhaust her. She does not ready during the following upkeep phase.

cards.flavor:
As she hovers in midair, Miss Lila's lifeless corpse 
thrums with a force that makes your eyes water.
cards.name: Miss Lila Starett
cards.text: Aloof. Miss Lila Starett cannot attack, and cannot move or be moved from her location except by effects on scenario cards. She cannot be defeated. Forced - If Miss Lila Starett is ready: As an additional cost to leave her location, you must spend 1 additional action and take 1 horror. [reaction] If you succeed at a Fight or evade action against Miss Lila Starett: Exhaust her. She does not ready during the following upkeep phase.

cards.flavor:
The severed hand of Elizabeth Salmon, 
hanged at the gallows for the crime of witchcraft in 1842.
cards.name: Hand of the Hag
cards.text:
Uses (2 charges)
[action] Spend 1 charge and exhaust Hand of the Hag: Exhaust up to two non-[[Elite]] enemies at your location. If a card at your location has the jinxed keyword, you may deal 1 damage to an exhausted enemy at your location.

cards.flavor:
"Her eyes opened, showing only whites---milky ovals infinitely eerie in 
the dark root-tangle of her sharp features and stringy hair."
---Fritz Leiber
cards.name: The Hag
cards.text: Jinxed. Elusive. At the end of the enemy phase, if The Hag is both ready and unengaged at a location with a [[Tenant]] story asset: She deals 1 damage to that asset. Forced - At the end of the round, disengage The Hag from all investigators and move her to the closest location with a [[Tenant]] story asset (and no investigators, if possible.)

cards.flavor:
Detective Lockhart's bedroom walls are covered in newspaper clippings and handwritten notes. 
He's been working on a case for a while now.
cards.name: Adrian Lockhart
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Test [combat]+[agility] (5). If you succeed, choose an investigator at your location to put 1 of their clues on Adrian Lockhart.

cards.flavor:
Miss Neal had just signed a contract to sing 
nightly at the Hotel Seasons bar. Her sour mood is understandable, given the circumstances.
cards.name: Anne Neal
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower]+[agility] (5). If you succeed, choose an investigator at your location to put 1 of their clues on Anne Neal.

cards.flavor: "Ma" Stein smuggles illicit goods up and down the coast on behalf of the O'Bannions. She's just turned in after a long night of work, and she's none too happy that you've come knocking on her door.
cards.name: Mabel Stein
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Test [intellect]+[combat] (5). If you succeed, choose an investigator at your location to put 1 of their clues on Mabel Stein.

cards.flavor: Señor Barrera is just passing through Arkham on his way to a convention in upstate New York, but while you're here, he has some magnificent horsehair brushes to show you.
cards.name: Sergio Barrera
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower]+[combat] (5). If you succeed, choose an investigator at your location to put 1 of their clues on Sergio Barrera.

cards.flavor: Suzy is a performing arts student from Boston, and is renting a room for the month while she auditions for a part at the Ward Theatre. She hasn't gone outside much.
cards.name: Suzy Brandt
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Test [intellect]+[agility] (5). If you succeed, choose an investigator at your location to put 1 of their clues on Suzy Brandt.

cards.flavor: Mrs. Vatrushko's nephew is working at their pawn shop in Rivertown, but he hasn't answered the phone in hours. Her worrying is beginning to get the better of her.
cards.name: Tatyana Vatrushko
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower]+[intellect] (5). If you succeed, choose an investigator at your location to put 1 of their clues on Tatyana Vatrushko.

cards.flavor: The Arkham P.D. has searched the apartment for clues, but perhaps you'll find something that they missed.
cards.name: Crime Scene
cards.text: [action] If the location Crime Scene is attached to has no clues on it, investigators at this location spend 1 [per_investigator]+1 clues as a group: Add this card to the Victory Display.

cards.flavor: The Arkham P.D. has searched the apartment for clues, but perhaps you'll find something that they missed.
cards.name: Crime Scene
cards.text: [action] If the location Crime Scene is attached to has no clues on it, investigators at this location spend 1 [per_investigator]+1 clues as a group: Add this card to the Victory Display.

cards.flavor: "She's calling me... Can't you hear her?"
cards.name: Beckoning
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (5). This test gets –1 difficulty for each [[Tenant]] story asset in play. If you fail, you must decide (choose one): - Take 1 horror and Beckoning gains surge. - Resolve the current Jinx. You automatically fail any tests triggered by this Jinx. - Deal 1 damage to a [[Tenant]] asset of your choice.

cards.flavor:
A solitary death's head moth flutters 
past your head and down the hallway. What an 
odd sight---could it mean something?
cards.name: Insatiable Curiosity
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, you must immediately move to the nearest copy of Tenement Corridors. If you are already at a copy of Tenement Corridors, move Miss Lila Starett to your location, instead.

cards.name: Unclean Spirit
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Unclean Spirit to a non-permanent, non-weakness asset under your control. Limit 1 per asset. If you cannot, Unclean Spirit gains surge. At the beginning of your turn, discard the top 2 cards of your deck. If you cannot, discard the attached asset. Forced - When the asset attached to Unclean Spirit leaves play: Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, attach Unclean Spirit to a different non-permanent, non-weakness asset under any investigator's control.

cards.name: Dancing with Death
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the number of cards with Victory Point 1 or higher in the victory display.
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail, move the nearest [[Bewitched]] enemy once towards you.
[tablet]: –2. If you fail, Spin the Performance Hall until its title is facing your location. If you are at the Performance Hall, take 1 horror instead.
[elder_thing]: –1. Take 1 damage or 1 horror.

cards.name: Dancing with Death
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is the number of cards with Victory Point 0 or higher in the victory display.
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail, move the nearest [[Bewitched]] enemy once towards you. If it enters your location, it immediately engages and attacks you.
[tablet]: –4. Spin the Performance Hall until its title is facing your location. If you are at the Performance Hall, take 1 direct horror instead.
[elder_thing]: –3. Take 1 damage and 1 horror.

cards.flavor: Nussbaum Academy for the Performing Arts was founded in the late 1890s by Helena Nussbaum, a wealthy and eccentric immigrant from Baden-Württemberg. Over the years the academy has earned wide international acclaim, with alumni featured in the London Symphony Orchestra and the Ballets Russes---but based on the state of affairs this evening, it's safe to say you're witnessing the Academy's final act.
cards.name: The Danse Macabre
cards.text: Jinx -- Spin the Performance Hall X times in a direction of your choice, where X is the amount you failed by. (Limit once per round.) Forced - When a story asset, story card, or non-weakness enemy with Victory 0 or higher enters the victory display: Remove 1 doom from this agenda (to a minimum of 1).

cards.name: A Final Bow
cards.text:
Somewhere in the academy, a grandfather clock tolls---once, twice, three times. Silence hangs heavy in the air. Then, without warning, one of the nearby bewitched students freezes in place. Her arms hang limply in the air like a marionette for what seems like an eternity, before the girl lets out a bloodcurdling scream, her eyes wide with terror. That sound triggers a chain reaction. Soon, another student joins in, then another, until the entire school erupts in a cacophony of horror. The shrieks claw at your sanity, a twisted symphony of despair that you can’t escape. It’s too much to bear, and your fear and instinct take over. You bolt for the exit, hands pressed against your ears, desperate to drown out the nightmare.
Add 1 [tablet] to the chaos bag for the remainder of the campaign. Each remaining investigator is defeated.

cards.flavor:
Thanks to Gigi's foresight, slipping into Nussbaum Academy is a breeze. If there's any dirt on Madame Giuliano here, finding it should be a walk in the park; if you didn't know better, you'd think school was out for the season.
So why can't you shake this nagging feeling of unease?
cards.name: Dancing with Death (v. I)
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, investigators may spend the requisite amount of clues as a group to advance.

cards.name: Pas de Chat
cards.text:
It quickly becomes apparent that all is not well within the prestigious dance academy. An eerie tension hangs in the air, and the sense of dread in the back of your mind has only grown larger. Though Gigi's ruse was vital in clearing out most of the students, the ones you encounter now are dazed and confused, moving languidly from room to room like sleepwalkers. Strangely, you've encountered no signs of the school's faculty. The Headmistress's chambers, you realize, could hold vital clues about Madame Giuliano's whereabouts, but they are securely locked, much like many other rooms dedicated to the school's staff. As you test the Headmistress's door, a small, glassy object tumbles down a nearby staircase, landing with a delicate thud. You pick it up and find it's an intricately carved bird in crystal. You crane your neck upward to see where it might have fallen from, but the top of the stairway is shrouded in darkness.
Choose an investigator to take control of the set-aside Glass Peacock story asset. Until the end of the scenario, this card does not take up a hand slot. Reveal any remaining unrevealed [[Academy]] locations except for the Headmistress' Chambers. Gather the set-aside Patricia Simms, Olga Safronova, and Sarah Pierce story assets. Put Patricia Simms into play at the Lecture Theatre, Olga Safronova at the Private Recital Chamber, and Sarah Pierce at the Student Dormitory.

cards.flavor: You're itching to get into the Headmistress' chambers, but her door is much sturdier than it looks. Maybe one of the students can help you find a key, if you can find any who still have their wits about them.
cards.name: Retombe
cards.text: Objective - If investigators at a location connected to the Headmistress' Chambers have at least 2 keys: You may choose to advance.

cards.name: Sur les Pointes
cards.text:
Once inside the Headmistress' chambers, you scour every nook and cranny, searching for any clue about Madame Giuliano. The minutes pass in silence until Gigi gasps. "I only just touched it," she says, pointing to an ornate wall carving of a blue flower. A hidden panel has opened beside her, revealing a dark passage. "D'you wanna see where it goes?" You both venture down a long, winding tunnel toward a faint, distant light. Eventually, you arrive at your destination---and wish you hadn't. Several women in robes encircle an open chamber, the lifeless body of a young woman contorted in agony at their center. An older, dark-skinned woman in a stylish suit---clearly their leader---paces over the corpse. "It's not enough," she laments, frustration coloring her voice. "There aren't enough suitable candidates for Helena's arrival. What will she say? We're running out of time." The leader whirls around to her followers, her eyes burning with rage. "We continue the sacrifices! The students must die! Helena, give me power---AAGH!" The sudden outburst startles you, and you realize Gigi has set the velvet curtains surrounding the room's perimeter on fire with a nearby candelabra. "I've had enough of this witchy nonsense," she hisses, her eyes blazing as flames spread throughout the chamber. "Let's get out of here!"
Reveal Headmistress' Chambers. Put the Chamber of Sighs into play, revealed, and move each investigator at a location adjacent to the Headmistress' Chambers to the Headmistress' Chambers. Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until two [[Witch]] enemies are revealed. Spawn one at the Chamber of Sighs, and the other at the Performance Hall. Then, Spin the Performance Hall until its top and bottom exits are facing each [[Academy]] location at the 3 and 9 o'clock positions. Gather the set-aside Blanche Pappenheimer enemy and put her into play at The Chamber of Sighs. Shuffle the Inferno encounter set into the encounter deck, along with the discard pile.

cards.flavor: Of all the things you expected to find in the depths of Nussbaum Academy, a coven of murderous witches wasn’t on the list. Gigi may have put a stop to their ritual, but you still need to get out of this place, and fast---before you end up as one of their sacrifices, as well.
cards.name: Contretemps
cards.text: The Academy Foyer gains "[action]: Resign." Objective - If each remaining investigator has resigned: Advance.

cards.name: Suspiriorum
cards.text:
You tear through the dimly lit halls of Nussbaum Academy, the manic cackling of Madame Pappenheimer's coven snapping at your heels. With one final sprint, you and Gigi crash through the front doors, spilling out into the cold night. You don't stop running until the academy is a distant silhouette against the moonlit sky, the coven's furious cries fading into the darkness.
→R1

cards.flavor: You had expected bedlam inside of Nussbaum Academy as the fire rages upstairs, but the scene that greets you inside is horrifying. The lifeless bodies of students lie sprawled throughout the grand mansion, and the few who are still conscious wander aimlessly from room to room, trapped in an unbreakable trance. What terrible witchcraft has happened here?
cards.name: Dancing with Death (v. II)
Deadly Inheritance
cards.text:
The atmosphere of chaos enveloping the academy seems to freeze as you hear the sound of heels clicking against the tiles behind you. At the far end of the hall is Ana Giuliano, the elegant grande dame from that notorious night at the Hotel Seasons, indifferent to the flames consuming the academy around her. "So," she purrs, "We finally meet face-to-face. I trust your recovery has been satisfactory?" Madame Giuliano laughs throatily as she sizes you up, her arms folded across her chest. "Unfortunately, your timing couldn't be more inconvenient. I'm here to collect on a debt owed by my sister, and there are matters to settle before I can take what's mine. Clearing the building of vermin, for instance." A distant scream pierces the school's eerie silence, sudden and jarring. The tension shatters, and Madame Giuliano seizes the moment. She slips quickly away down the hall to the Headmistress' Chambers, her taunting voice echoing back to you. "Find me below when you tire of playing games, darling. I'll be waiting for you."
Put The Chamber of Sighs into play, revealed. Gather the set-aside Vivat Regina encounter set and put Ana Giuliano into play at the Chamber of Sighs with 2 resource tokens (from the token bank) on her as barrier tokens (3, if there are 3 or more investigators.) Reveal each unrevealed location in play other than the Headmistress' Chambers. Then, search all set-aside cards and the victory display for the [[Elite]] Sarah Pierce, Olga Safronova, and Patricia Simms enemies, and spawn them in the The Greenhouse, The Natatorium, and the Dining Hall. Attach one of the Binding Charm treacheries to each of these enemies. Shuffle each copy of Queenly Majesty into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile. Ana Giuliano's maximum barrier value is 2 (3, if there are 3 or more investigators.) Put this card next to the agenda deck as a reminder.

cards.flavor: As the inferno consumes Nussbaum Academy above, Madame Giuliano flees into the school's depths. You must follow after her if you wish to put an end to this madness.
cards.name: Chassé En Tournant
cards.text: As an additional cost to take the [action] action listed on Binding Charm treacheries, you must be engaged with the [[Performer]] enemy it is attached to. This action does not trigger attacks of opportunity. [action] If an investigator at a location connected to the Headmistress' Chambers has at least 1 key: Reveal the Headmistress' Chambers. Forced - If an effect would cause Ana Giuliano to leave The Chamber of Sighs: Cancel that effect and add 1 doom to the agenda, instead. Objective - If Ana Giuliano is defeated: Advance.

cards.name: Grande Reverence
cards.text:
Despite the nightmarish horrors you'd witnessed this evening, Ana Giuliano's command of the eldritch arts catches you by surprise. She swiftly counters your attacks with an imperceptible barrier, and her own barrage of withering spells inflict searing pain on you and your companions. Yet, through sheer tenacity---or a stroke of luck---you manage to gradually wear down her defenses in an intense and grueling battle. With her back to the wall, Madame Giuliano starts to laugh---a soft, self-satisfied chuckle that swells, growing louder and louder until it transforms into the howling cackle of a madwoman.
→R2

cards.name: Academy Foyer
cards.text:
[reaction] After you evade an enemy at Academy Foyer: Immediately move to the Grand Salon.
[action][action]: Gain 3 resources. (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
Nussbaum Academy itself is a massive manor estate, 
its scarlet exterior adorned with intricate gold 
detailing and large latticed windows. Rumors say 
that the building is an exact replica of Madame Nussbaum's family home in Germany.
cards.name: Nussbaum Academy
Grand Salon
cards.text: Forced - When the locations on the immediate left and right of the Grand Salon are revealed, put an additional 1 [per_investigator] clues on them. Locations to the immediate left and right of the Grand Salon get –1 shroud.

cards.flavor:
The academy's vestibule is lavish indeed---almost overwhelmingly so. The stylish, modern decor 
makes the Hotel Seasons's attempts at achieving 
the same aesthetic feel almost chintzy.
cards.name: Grand Salon
Performance Hall
cards.text:
Jinxed.
The Performance Hall is connected to the locations immediately above and below its top and bottom sides, and vice versa.
When an enemy would move clockwise from the Performance Hall, it does so from its top exit; if it would move counter-clockwise, it does so from the bottom.

cards.flavor:
Performances in Nussbaum Academy's theatre hall 
are usually reserved for guest artists, or for 
productions in honor of visiting dignitaries. It's rare 
to see a student allowed on its beautiful stage.
cards.name: Performance Hall
Headmistress' Chambers
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, if an investigator is inside the Headmistress' Chambers: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is revealed. Spawn that enemy at the Performance Hall and spin it once in any direction.

cards.flavor:
The dramatic door at the end of the hall leads 
to the offices of Madame Pappenheimer, 
the academy's current deputy headmistress. 
Despite your best efforts, it won't budge an inch.
cards.name: Headmistress' Chambers
cards.text: You cannot enter the Headmistress' Chambers.

cards.flavor: There are cold, unfinished meals still on the table.
cards.name: Dining Hall
cards.text:
[action][action] Spend 2 clues: Heal 2 damage. (Limit once per game). 
While Dining Hall is connected to Performance Hall, you may not activate [action] abilities on player cards at Dining Hall.

cards.flavor:
Nussbaum Academy's vibrant red exterior 
stands in startling contrast to the dark 
woodland that surrounds it. It must have cost 
a fortune to build so far away from the city.
cards.name: Nussbaum Academy Interior

cards.flavor: The three statues that act as the garden's centerpieces appear to be quite old. Curiously, most of the greenery has wilted.
cards.name: Greenhouse
cards.text:
Jinxed.
[free]: Each investigator at the Greenhouse immediately takes 1 mental trauma. Reduce the amount of doom on the agenda by 1. (Limit once per game.)
While Greenhouse is connected to Performance Hall, as an additional cost to take a move action at Greenhouse, randomly discard a card from your hand.

cards.flavor:
Nussbaum Academy's vibrant red exterior 
stands in startling contrast to the dark 
woodland that surrounds it. It must have cost 
a fortune to build so far away from the city.
cards.name: Nussbaum Academy Interior

cards.flavor:
Although Nussbaum Academy is primarily a school for the arts, 
it does contain a traditional academic classroom 
suited for students that are less likely to achieve stardom.
cards.name: Lecture Theatre
cards.text: [free] Spend up to 3 clues: Spin the Performance Hall that many times in any direction. (Limit once per round.) Forced - At the beginning of the investigation phase, if an investigator is at Lecture Theatre and it is connected to Performance Hall: Refresh clues on the Lecture Theatre to its maximum clue value.

cards.flavor:
Nussbaum Academy's vibrant red exterior 
stands in startling contrast to the dark 
woodland that surrounds it. It must have cost 
a fortune to build so far away from the city.
cards.name: Nussbaum Academy Interior

cards.flavor: The academy's indoor swimming pool is both a shimmering vision of opulence and a testament to Helena Nussbaum's vast fortune.
cards.name: Natatorium
cards.text: [free] Spend 3 clues: Immediately take an action as if it were your turn (this action does not count toward the number of actions you can take each turn). Refresh clues on this location to its maximum clue value. While Natatorium is connected to Performance Hall, Move, fight and evade actions at Natatorium cost one additional action.

cards.flavor:
Nussbaum Academy's vibrant red exterior 
stands in startling contrast to the dark 
woodland that surrounds it. It must have cost 
a fortune to build so far away from the city.
cards.name: Nussbaum Academy Interior

cards.flavor: Students are often required to entertain esteemed visitors to the school in these private chambers, sometimes until the wee hours of the morning.
cards.name: Private Recital Chamber
cards.text:
[reaction] After you move to the Private Recital Chamber: Move a non-[[Elite]] enemy from a connecting location to your location, or vice versa. Spin the Performance Hall once, counter-clockwise.
While Private Recital Chamber is connected to Performance Hall, investigators at Private Recital Chamber get –2 to fight and investigate actions.

cards.flavor:
Nussbaum Academy's vibrant red exterior 
stands in startling contrast to the dark 
woodland that surrounds it. It must have cost 
a fortune to build so far away from the city.
cards.name: Nussbaum Academy Interior

cards.flavor:
Due to a recent infestation of termites, students have vacated 
their usual rooms in favor of this impromptu 
sleeping area in one of the school's spare ballrooms.
cards.name: Student Dormitory
cards.text:
[free] Spend up to 3 clues or resources: Move that many clues from a connecting location to the Student Dormitory. Spin the Performance Hall once, clockwise. (Limit once per round.)
While Student Dormitory is connected to Performance Hall, its base shroud is 5.

cards.flavor:
Nussbaum Academy's vibrant red exterior 
stands in startling contrast to the dark 
woodland that surrounds it. It must have cost 
a fortune to build so far away from the city.
cards.name: Nussbaum Academy Interior
Blanche Pappenheimer
cards.text: Retaliate. Blanche Pappenheimer gets +1 [per_investigator] health. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Blanche Pappenheimer is ready: Search the encounter deck for a [[Performer]] enemy and spawn it at the Performance Hall. Then, spin the Performance Hall clockwise twice.

cards.name: Chamber of Sighs
cards.text: Jinxed. Forced - While an investigator is in the Chamber of Sighs, each [[Bewitched]] enemy loses any hunter and patrol keywords and gains "Patrol (Chamber of Sighs)."

cards.flavor:
Olga twirls about the room like a marionette on invisible strings, 
each movement more erratic and jarring than the next. 
Fresh blood seeps through the soles of her ballet slippers.
cards.name: Olga Safronova
cards.text: [action]: Test [willpower] + [agility] (8) to attempt to shake Olga out of her trance. As an additional cost, you may spend any number of actions when initiating this test. For each additional action spent, reduce the difficulty of this test by 3. If you succeed, flip this card over.

cards.name: Olga's Rescue
cards.text:
You grab Olga by the shoulders and shake her as hard as you can. It takes effort, but you are finally able to pull her from the trance before she dances herself to death. "Thanks," she wheezes, letting her body sag against you. You cut to the chase, asking if she can help you break into the Headmistress’ office. She shakes her head, too exhausted to do more than think about escaping from the academy. She does, however, let you know that she's hidden one of the keys to Madame Pappenheimer's office elsewhere in the academy.
Gather one of the set-aside keys and put it three locations away from you clockwise (skipping the Headmistress' Chambers). Remember that you may use a [free] action to pick up a key on a location with no clues on it. Flip this card over and add Olga Safronova to the victory display.

cards.flavor: "Names which begin with the letter 'S' are the names of snakes," babbles Patricia, her knees pressed against her chest. "Darkness, Tears, and Sighs. I could explain everything to you, but I think it would be wrong."
cards.name: Patricia Simms
cards.text: [action]: Test [willpower] + [combat] (8) to attempt to shake Patricia out of her trance. As an additional cost, you may spend any number of actions when initiating this test. For each additional action spent, reduce the difficulty of this test by 3. If you succeed, flip this card over.

cards.name: Patricia's Rescue
cards.text:
"Step aside, toots," Gigi says, tired of Patricia’s hysterics. She steps up, her voice sharp and cutting. "Listen here, Missy! You think you’re the first little girl to ever be scared of somethin’? Well, I’ve got news for you!" Something about the shrill, nasal edge of Gigi’s voice as she berates the girl manages to slice through Patricia’s trance. Dazed, Patricia blinks, then thanks you both for pulling her out of it. She quickly tells you about a secret key to the Headmistress’ office that she's tucked away, in case you can help save Madame Pappenheimer from whatever horrors have overcome the school. As Patricia runs off, Gigi smirks, self-satisfied. "See?" she says. "Nothin’ to it!"
Gather one of the set-aside keys and put it three locations away from you counter-clockwise (skipping the Headmistress' Chambers). Remember that you may use a [free] action to pick up a key on a location with no clues on it. Flip this card over and add Patricia Simms to the victory display.

cards.flavor: You discover Sarah with her cheek pressed against the wallpaper, humming a haunting melody into the corner. When you coax her around, her glazed and bewildered eyes dilate in the light.
cards.name: Sarah Pierce
cards.text: [action]: Test [willpower] + [intellect] (8) to attempt to shake Sarah out of her trance. As an additional cost, you may spend any number of actions when initiating this test. For each additional action spent, reduce the difficulty of this test by 3. If you succeed, flip this card over.

cards.name: Sarah's Rescue
cards.text:
With some effort, you manage to snap Sarah out of her trance. Her voice is raspy and hoarse, worn thin from hours spent singing a haunting, mournful melody she can barely recall. You urge her to get out of the school---fast. "But wait," she whispers, her voice tiny and strained. "If you need to find the Headmistress, I’ve hidden a key where no one else will think to look…"
Gather one of the set-aside keys and put it at The Performance Hall. Remember that you may use a [free] action to pick up a key on a location with no clues on it. Flip this card over and add Sarah Pierce to the victory display.

cards.flavor: The sculpture from beneath Madame Pappenheimer's office gleams in the light, casting vibrant colors across your hands.
cards.name: Glass Peacock
cards.text:
You get +1 [willpower].
[action] If an enemy with the jinxed keyword is at your location, discard Glass Peacock: Exhaust that enemy. If the enemy is non-[[Elite]], deal 2 damage to it. This action does not trigger attacks of opportunity.

cards.flavor:
She's everything a mother could ask for---
after a few small adjustments, of course.
cards.name: Gigi Giuliano
cards.text: Jinxed. Hunter. Spawn - Performance Hall.

cards.flavor: Perfection commands sacrifice.
cards.name: Immolated Dancer
cards.text: Alert. Elusive. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Immolated Dancer is at a location containing at least one other [[Performer]] enemy: Put 1 doom on Immolated Dancer.

cards.flavor:
There will be nothing of her left inside. 
Only space for art.
cards.name: Spellbound Soloist
cards.text: Alert. Patrol (Clockwise.) Spawn - Private Recital Chamber (Otherwise, Performance Hall.) Forced - After Spellbound Soloist resolves her patrol keyword during the enemy phase, if she is unengaged: Resolve her patrol keyword again. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: Darkness binds the gifted.
cards.name: Enthralled Student
cards.text: Spawn - Connecting Location. Aloof. Jinxed. Patrol (Counterclockwise.) As an additional cost to enter Enthralled Student's location, you must either (choose one): - Spend 1 additional action - Place 1 doom on Enthralled Student and resolve her patrol keyword.

cards.flavor: Movement is never mute. It is a language.
cards.name: Dancing Plague
cards.text: Revelation - Put Dancing Plague into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - When you take a move action: Take 1 damage or 1 horror. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard 1 copy of Dancing Plague from play.

cards.flavor: Give your soul to the dance.
cards.name: En Avant
cards.text: Revelation - Resolve the hunter, patrol, or elusive keyword on a [[Performer]] enemy in play. Resolve this effect X additional times. X is the number of [[Performer]] cards in the victory display. If no enemies were moved due to this effect, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Performer]] enemy and spawn it in the Performance Hall.

cards.flavor: What we were, you are; what we are, you will be.
cards.name: Vanitas
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. Spin the Performance Hall clockwise X times. X is that token's numeric modifier +1.

cards.name: The Teachings of Aradia
cards.text: Easy / Standard [skull]: –X. X is half the number of clues remaining on your location (rounded up). [cultist]: –2. If you fail, move an enemy at a [[Reflection]] location to the nearest [[Primordial]] location. [tablet]: –2. If you fail, take 1 damage or horror. [elder_thing]: –4. You may choose to return a [[Reflection]] enemy in the Victory Display to the [[Reflection]] deck. If you do, treat this token as a 0, instead.

cards.name: The Teachings of Aradia
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is one more than the number of clues remaining on your location.
[cultist]: –3. Move an enemy to the [[Primordial]] location closest to it.
[tablet]: –3. If you fail, take 1 damage and 1 horror.
[elder_thing]: –4. Return a [[Reflection]] enemy in the Victory Display to the [[Reflection]] deck.

cards.flavor:
"As air permeates water, as ether permeates the densest solid, so does astral matter permeate all physical. The astral world is above us, below us, on every side of us, through us; we live and move in it, but it is intangible, invisible, inaudible, imperceptible, because the prison of the physical body shuts us away from it."
---Annie Besant, The Ancient Wisdom
cards.name: Stars and Rain
cards.text: * This agenda gets +1 [per_investigator] doom threshold. Jinx -- Put a clue on your location from the token bank.

cards.name: Thieves in the Night
cards.text:
A thunderous crash reverberates through the air, accompanied by a gale of cold wind that chills you to your bones---and then, silence. "They’re here," whispers Maddalena’s voice. You haven't known her long, but you recognize the tone of her voice---a pure, unmitigated dread that speaks volumes.
Each remaining investigator is defeated.

cards.flavor: Alone in this dark and unfathomable place, you endure the endless storm, desperately attempting to keep sight of the white owl overhead.
cards.name: Adrift in the Astral
cards.text: [reaction] At the beginning of the Mythos phase, you may choose to take 1 direct damage or 1 direct horror. If you do: Do not draw a card from the encounter deck this mythos phase. Objective - Find safe harbor in the Astral Plane. (You will be instructed when to advance.)

cards.name: The Long Quiet
cards.text:
Once through the void, you inexplicably find yourself on a small island, lost in a dark sea. You are in some kind of open-air temple with a brazier burning brightly at the center of the stone floor. Maddalena sits in deep concentration, the white owl perched on her shoulder. "Welcome to my home," she says, matter-of-factly. "I hope now you understand the gravity of our situation." You’re furious. Maddalena's cryptic explanations have helped you understand very little, except that she has drawn you against your will into a deadly plot; one that has endangered not only the both of you, but all of Arkham---and possibly the world beyond. For her part, Maddalena just chuckles miserably at your rage and her misfortune. "Very well, then. I’ll make sure you understand completely. The Sorrows know we’re here and will send their thralls across time to find us. I can prevent their entry easily as long as I remain undisturbed, but if you can seal their entrances to my sanctuary, it will guarantee our survival. And perhaps, you’ll learn just how terrible they truly are."
Each investigator loses all of their clues. Gather the 6 set-aside [[Reflection]] locations and place 2 next to each [[Primordial]] location, revealed. Until the end of the scenario, each [[Primordial]] location is connected to the 2 [[Reflection]] locations next to it (and vice-versa.) Put this card next to the Agenda deck, as a reminder. Put Maddalena Talenti into play at The Long Quiet. Gather the set-aside deck of [[Reflection]] enemies and the Shattered Reflections story card and set them next to the Agenda deck.

cards.flavor: To ensure your continued well-being, you'll need to dilligently seal up the entrances to Maddalena's Sanctuary that the Sorrows have so rudely carved open.
cards.name: Lessons from the Past
cards.text: [free] If you are at a [[Reflection]] location with no enemies or clues: Move each investigator at your location to the nearest [[Primordial]] location, and put that [[Reflection]] location in the Victory Display. Forced - At the beginning of the investigation phase: Resolve the effects of the Shattered Reflections story card. Objective - If all 6 [[Reflection]] locations are in the Victory Display: Advance.

cards.name: Lessons Learned
cards.text:
With the last reflection sealed away, Maddalena’s voice echoes in your mind, a sensation that’s becoming almost uncomfortably familiar. "Good," she says. "Come back to me now." You haven’t known Maddalena long enough to be sure, but there’s a hint of something in her voice that might just be pride---or at least the closest thing to it she’s capable of.
→R1.

cards.name: Primordial Chaos
cards.text:
Jinxed. Veiled.
Increase the cost of the first card you play at Primordial Chaos during your turn by 1.

cards.name: A Light in the Storm
cards.text:
Maddalena's words echo in your mind as you race to keep up with the white owl. "This is the Astral Plane," she says. "The realm of quintessence, and of the soul. Here, I hold power strong enough to keep you safe. But we are not alone---three great evils from the dawn of time pursue us. The Three Mothers---Tenebrarum, Suspiriorum, and Lachrymarum. The Sorrows. The primordial storm through which we now walk is their birthplace." You shield your eyes from the pounding rain as you shout up to the owl above. Wouldn't that mean that these Sorrows---whoever they are---wield power here, as well? "Yes," the voice replies. "So we keep moving."
Put Antediluvian Waters into play. Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a treachery from the Unhallowed Land set is revealed and attach it to Antediluvian Waters. This encounter set can be identified by the following icon: Flip this card back over.

cards.name: Antediluvean Waters
cards.text:
Jinxed. Veiled.
Increase the difficulty to fight or evade enemies at Antediluvean Waters by 1.
[free] During your turn, draw the top card of the encounter deck. After resolving its effects, discover 1 clue at Antediluvean Waters. (Limit once per turn.)

cards.name: A Sea of Troubles
cards.text:
A thousand questions blaze in your mind as you slog through the sandbanks of the ancient sea. Why are these "Sorrows" after you? Who is this woman, guiding you through this bizarre place? "I am a servant of Aradia di Tuscano, breaker of shackles and daughter of the goddess Diana," says Maddalena's voice. "The Sorrows have been enemies of my lady for eons. As I said, they hold immense power here in the Astral Plane. But on Earth, their strength is tethered to their lairs---places of great significance to them. For reasons I do not know, for the first time in a millennium, each of the Three Mothers had left her lair and converged upon your Arkham. I moved against them, and... misjudged their stength."
Put The Yawning Void into play. Search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 [per_investigator] copies of Grasping Shadow. Spawn those enemies at each location in play (empty locations first, if possible.) Flip this card back over.

cards.name: The Yawning Void
cards.text: Jinxed. Veiled. Forced - When you fail an Investigation test at The Yawning Void, in addition to resolving the current Jinx: Draw the top card of the encounter deck. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: A Mountain of Regret
cards.text:
You dodge the violent, clawing shadows snapping at your heels and push upward toward the great spiraling void. "Servants of the Sorrows," Maddalena explains as her owl soars through the giant hole. "This realm is a prison for the souls of their prey." Out of breath, you wonder aloud---why you? Why are the Sorrows after you? What does any of this have to do with you? For the first time, Maddalena’s voice falters. "I… thought I would need help. Of all the people in Arkham, I learned of you and your exploits. I believed no one else would have been capable to contend against them, and was... too eager. Yet, now, in my haste… I appear to have damned us both." Her voice falls silent for a moment before regaining its usual commanding tone. "Come. You’re almost there. Enter the void."
Put The Long Quiet into play and move each investigator there. Flip this card back over.

cards.flavor: This nexus should allow you a way to explore the reflections that Maddalena requires you to seal before she deems you ready to leave.
cards.name: The Long Quiet

cards.flavor: Much has been written about the unique charms of San Francisco: a thrilling, near-lawless sanctuary for bohemians, intellectuals, and eccentrics. Perhaps under normal circumstances you'd relish the opportunity to explore the city by the bay, but the longer you walk its streets, the more certain you are that some unspeakable thing lies hidden deep within its heart---something that wants you gone.
cards.name: A World in Gray
cards.text: [free] If your location has the [[Rail]] trait and no Fog Tokens on it, spend 1 resource: Move to another [[Rail]] location. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: The Fog, Now Risen
cards.text: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a copy of Trolley Problem or The Fog Rolls is revealed. Draw that card.

cards.flavor:
"This city is a point upon a map of fog; Lemuria in a city unknown. Like us, it doesn't quite exist."
---Ambrose Bierce
cards.name: A World in Gray
cards.text: [free] If your location has the [[Rail]] trait and no Fog Tokens on it, spend 1 resource: Move to another [[Rail]] location. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: The Fog, Now Risen
cards.text: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a copy of Her Dark Influence or The Killer Strikes! is revealed. Draw that card.

cards.flavor:
"San Francisco is gone. 
Nothing remains of it but memories."
---Jack London
cards.name: Leave Your Heart Behind
cards.text: [free] If your location has the [[Rail]] trait and no Fog Tokens on it, spend 2 resources: Move to another [[Rail]] location. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: The Fog, Now Risen
cards.text: Each remaining investigator is defeated.

cards.flavor: The headlines are the same, everywhere you look: San Francisco awakens to another gruesome murder every new day, each victim linked by a shadowy gentleman's club known as the Tenebrarum Lodge. Finding the elusive lodge's headquarters will help you learn whether Mater Tenebrarum herself is behind all of this---but first, you've got to track it down.
cards.name: The City of Fog
cards.text: Jinx -- Place a Fog Token on Land's End, The Embarcadero, or Corona Heights. (Limit once per phase.) Objective - If the Tenebrarum Lodge is revealed: Advance.

cards.name: Inside the Black Lodge
cards.text:
The chaos inside the Tenebrarum Lodge is palpable. One pale and sweating man reclines on a chaise lounge, pressing a damp cloth to a deep cut on his brow; another frantically relays information to the police over the telephone. Several lifeless bodies lie around the parlor. The wounded man opens one bloodshot eye as you make your entrance. "We've got company, Dashiell." You explain that you've been searching for the Tenebrarum Lodge, and the reclining man laughs bitterly. "Congratulations," he says, his voice laced with irony. "You've found our secret lair. Make yourself at home." The two men introduce themselves as Erle Gardner and Dashiell Hammett, two aspiring writers and members of the Tenebrarum Lodge. Once Hammett is off the phone, he gives you the lowdown: the Tenebrarum killer has struck again, just moments before your arrival. "The bastard's name is Pietro Spadarotto, an art dealer who joined the Lodge a few months back. He broke in, made a real spectacle of stealing a book, then opened fire." You wonder aloud what book could be worth killing for. "It’s by one of our founding members: 'Megapolisomancy' by Thibaut de Castries. Some occult drivel about using geometry or buildings to do magic. Pure fiction." Hammett shrugs, his voice tinged with disdain. "We’ve got a few copies lying around. Take one if you like. Hell, maybe it’ll even make sense to you."
Choose an investigator to take control of the set aside Megapolisomancy story asset.
Additionally, each investigator that was "invited to join the Tenebrarum Lodge" may read the following text:
You mention the invitation you received to join the Lodge, and Hammett’s expression twists into something you can’t quite pin down. "Miss Mercer doesn’t send out invitations on a whim, only to those she knows are meant for success," he says. "What did you do to impress her?" When you admit you don’t know, a slow, knowing smile curls on his lips. "I suppose it doesn’t matter," he murmurs. "If Mercer says you're in, then she must have something special in store for you."
You gain 2 experience. Search the collection for a random [[Humanoid]] or [[Monster]] weakness and add it to your deck.

cards.flavor:
"There are entities among us who are not human, perhaps not even a part of reality as we currently define it. I call them paramentals---'para' indicating 'outside' and 'elemental' being a force of nature."
 ---Thibaut de Castries,
 Megapolisomancy: A New Science of Cities
With de Castries' seminal book in hand, you return to the streets. The murderer is out there in the fog somewhere, and you mean to find him.
cards.name: Murder in the Mist
cards.text: Jinx -- Move a Fog Token from a connecting location to your current location. Objective - At the end of the round, if there are 4 or more locations in play with Fog Tokens on them: The investigators may spend the requisite number of clues as a group to advance.

cards.name: A Girl and Her Dog
cards.text:
You’ve begun to understand why Spadarotto was so desperate to get his hands on Thibaut de Castries' book. By tapping into the bizarre art of megapolisomancy, the art dealer has been slipping into the very fabric of the city through the fog---a trick he never imagined anyone would turn against him. When you finally find him, he’s on his hands and knees in the muck, sniveling like a dog in front of a tall, stately woman. "Miss Mercer," he sobs, his voice thick with desperation. "Haven’t I made you proud? Isn't it enough, yet? Why aren't you happy?" Spadarotto’s tears are met with nothing but cold indifference. The fog curls around them, but it’s clear who holds the power here. Miss Mercer lifts her gaze from the pathetic sight before her to acknowledge you with a cold, mocking stare. "You big oaf," she laughs, her voice a deadly mix of sugar and ice. "All that power sure did make you stupid. You didn’t even bother to check if someone was tailing you." She turns, the sound of her heels echoing against the pavement as she walks away. "Clean up your mess." Spadarotto whirls around, and you can see it in his eyes---he’s lost it completely. With a terrified shriek, he bolts in the opposite direction, driven by pure, mindless panic.
Move each investigator to the nearest [[San Francisco]] location and remove the following locations from the game, if applicable: Tenebrarum Lodge, Ah Toy's Pleasure Parlor, The House of Shields, and Madame Moustache's. The lead investigator must decide (choose one):
- We've got to stop the killer! For each Fog Token on Corona Heights, place a new Fog Token on a location in play, prioritizing locations without Fog Tokens if possible. Then, remove Corona Heights from the game. Put Pietro Spadarotto into play at the location with a fog token furthest from all investigators. Advance to Act 3a: Stop the Tenebrarum Killer!
- We have to follow that woman! Put Milly Mercer into play at Corona Heights. Advance to Act 3c: The Shadow of the Queen.

cards.flavor: You've tracked down the twisted art dealer Pietro Spadarotto, and uncovered the method behind his string of heinous murders. Now, all that's left is to cut off his escape route into the fog and put an end to his crime spree once and for all.
cards.name: Stop the Tenebrarum Killer!
cards.text: Forced - Locations with a Fog Token on them gain the jinxed keyword. Jinx -- Put a Fog Token on your current location. Objective - If Pietro Spadarotto is defeated: Advance.

cards.name: Just a Fling
cards.text:
With nowhere for him left to run, capturing Spadarotto is surprisingly easy. The choked whine he makes when you shoulder him to the ground would be almost comical, if not for all the carnage he's left in his wake.
→R1.

cards.flavor: These murders won't stop until you find the woman that's pulling the killer's strings. Track her down before Spadarotto gets another chance to strike.
cards.name: The Shadow of the Queen
cards.text: Forced - Locations with a Fog Token on them gain the jinxed keyword. [reaction] If there are at least 1 [per_investigator] Fog Tokens on Corona Heights: Until the end of the round, you may treat the text box on the back of Corona Heights as if it is blank (except for traits.) Jinx -- Place a Fog Token on Corona Heights. Objective - If Milly Mercer is defeated: →R2.

cards.name: A Voice from the Shadows
cards.text:
You're a curious little kitten, aren't you? I like that. Keep thinking. Questioning. That instinct might just keep you alive. If you know to pull the right thread, the whole thing unravels. I should know. So, have you decided yet? Whether or not you're coming with me? Or maybe you’re not as clever as I'm giving you credit for. I'll spell it out for you. Take this---consider it a parting gift. Show me you're worth the effort.
The investigator who revealed the back of this card immediately gains 2 bonus experience and must add the set-aside Umbral Katadesmos weakness to their deck. This card does not count toward that investigator's deck size. Flip this card back over. You may not flip this card over again.

cards.name: Financial District
cards.text: Investigators at this location may choose to gain 1 additional resource instead of drawing cards during the upkeep phase.

cards.flavor:
Business carries on as usual in spite of the dread that the Tenebrarum Killer has instilled in San Francisco. Pedestrians climb on and off of the cable cars at Powell Street, and the city hums with the pulse of urban life. 
You're beginning to miss the luxury of such normalcy.
cards.name: Financial District

cards.flavor:
Keep walking. 
Everyone knows what happens to nosy fellows in Chinatown.
cards.name: Chinatown
cards.text:
Assets played at Chinatown cost –1 resource.
As an additional cost to take a move action at Chinatown, discard 1 random card from your hand.

cards.flavor:
Although most of the criminal Tongs have been 
run out by the law in the years since the great 
earthquake, Chinatown is still recovering from decades 
of poverty, overcrowding, and discrimination.

If you succeed, defeat Milly Mercer and put her in the victory display. If you fail, Milly Mercer attacks you.

"Corona Heights looked steadily downward and northeast 
away at the nervous, bright lights of downtown San Francisco 
as if it were a great predatory beast of night 
surveying its territory in patient search of prey."
---Fritz Leiber, Our Lady of Darkness

cards.flavor:
The longer you spend exploring the Tenderloin, 
the less you believe the rumors. You doubt 
the locals would allow any beat cop foolish enough 
to attempt a patrol here to leave in one piece.

cards.text: Forced - After you discover any number of clues at this location, test [agility] (3). If you fail, resolve the hunter keyword on the nearest eligible enemy.

cards.flavor:
This dangerous neighborhood gets its name from 
the policemen that patrol its streets, who are 
rumored to accept bribes large enough to allow them 
the budget for expensive tenderloin cuts of beef.
cards.name: The Tenderloin
The Presidio

cards.flavor:
There's a familiar scent hanging in the air. 
It takes a moment until you realize---it's blood.

Of all the many brothels one can find along San Francisco's

cards.flavor: The loud, mournful droning outside is just the sound of foghorns from the ships stuck out in the gloom. Probably.
cards.name: The Embarcadero
cards.text:
While The Embarcadero has a Fog Token on it, it gains veiled.
While there are clues remaining on The Embarcadero, investigators at The Embarcadero get –2 to all skill tests.

cards.name: The Embarcadero
cards.text:
If an investigator at your location controls the Megapolisomancy story asset:
De Castries' book reveals a new layer to the Ferry Building’s façade---the subtle, geometric angles etched into the base of its cornerstones make it clear that whoever designed the building intended it to serve as some kind of conduit. While its original purpose remains a mystery, the tome should allow you to harness its power for your own needs.
You may move any number of Fog Tokens on The Embarcadero to any [[San Francisco]] location. For each Fog Token moved in this way, gain 1 resource.
Otherwise:
A faceless figure is outlined against the mist, just barely obscured by the fog. A long droning noise emanates from its direction---something halfway between a wounded animal and the whine of rusty machinery. By the time you muster the courage to face it head-on, it has already vanished.
If any Fog Dwellers are in play, choose one and shuffle it back into the encounter deck.
In either case: Flip this card back over. It may not be flipped over again.

cards.flavor: Music pours out of every bar, every storefront---it's almost deafening. If the killer were to strike here, would anyone even notice?
cards.name: Fillmore District
cards.text:
Veiled.
While you are at Fillmore District, increase the cost of each event you play by 1.
[action] Spend 2 resources: Heal 1 damage, Heal 1 horror, or draw 2 cards. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: At the Crossroads
cards.text:
An old woman in a fur coat steps off the trolley at Fillmore and Geary, cradling three tiny, fluffy dogs in her arms. She catches you staring and flashes you a warm smile. "I like dogs! Welcome to San Francisco," she beams, before disappearing down the bustling city street. It strikes you as odd that she was probably the first friendly person you've met since you arrived in this awful city, and possibly the last. The trolley's conductor isn’t as cheerful. He slams a fist against the controls, cursing under his breath. "Damn thing's always breaking down," he grumbles. It looks like you won't be able to take the train for a while.
Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a copy of Trolley Problem and put it into play next to the agenda deck. Then, move up to 2 clues from another [[Rail]] location to the Fillmore District. Flip this card back over. It may not be flipped over again.

cards.flavor: The spray of saltwater hangs on the breeze as the waves crash against the rocks below. You could probably see for miles, if the horizon wasn't obscured by the fog.
cards.name: Land's End
cards.text:
While Land's End has a Fog Token on it, it gains veiled.
Land's End gets +1 shroud for each clue on this location.

cards.name: Land's End
cards.text:
If an investigator at your location controls the Megapolisomancy story asset:
De Castries' book warns that the strength of Megapolisomantic magic weakens the further one ventures from a city's heart. Here, on the city’s outermost edge, you find his theory holds true---it takes far more effort than usual to bend the fog to your will. As you struggle with the mist, you catch a strange sight---a distant figure, brown and twisted, dances erratically on a faraway cliff, as if caught in the wind. You watch, uneasy, until it vanishes without a trace.
Put a Fog Token on the furthest [[San Francisco]] location from you without a Fog Token. (If all eligible locations already have a Fog Token on them, put a Fog Token on Corona Heights instead.) Spawn the set-aside The Pale Brown Thing enemy at that location. Flip this card back over. It may not be flipped over again.
Otherwise:
You tighten your coat around your shoulders as the sharp sea breeze cuts through the air. All the stories you’ve heard about California never prepared you for this kind of bracing cold.
Move all Fog Tokens on Land's End to The Presidio. Flip this card back over. Any investigator may flip this card over again.

cards.flavor:
De Castries' seminal work explores rituals that allow the caster to 
divine the fate of an entire city, as well as the existence of 'paramentals'---hostile spirits borne from the collective unconscious of city dwellers.
cards.name: Megapolisomancy
cards.text:
Megapolisomancy cannot leave play. If you are defeated, choose another investigator to take control of Megapolisomancy.
[action] Spend 1 clue, as a group: Choose a Fog Token at your location. You may remove that token from the game, move a Fog Token at a connecting location to your location, or place a new Fog Token at a connecting location.

cards.flavor:
A collection of fifty occult symbols, along with Thibaut de 
Castries' handwritten notes on their relation to 
the concept of 'megapolisomancy'---whatever that is.
cards.name: De Castries' Grand Cipher
cards.text:
You get +1 [intellect].
[free] Take 1 direct horror and exhaust De Castries' Grand Cipher: Choose either the current Act or Agenda. Until the end of the round, each investigator may treat that card as if it does not contain a Jinx.

cards.flavor:
She has her mother's charm, her father's cunning, 
and a personal vendetta as deep as the sea.
cards.name: Naomi O'Bannion
cards.text:
You get +1 [intellect] and +1 [combat].
[free] Exhaust Naomi O'Bannion and deal 1 damage to her: Defeat a non-[[Elite Witch]] enemy at your location.

cards.flavor:
"...I bind by inscription.... divide... 
just as her hounds lie dead, so may she never..."
cards.name: Umbral Katadesmos
cards.text: Revelation - Put Umbral Katadesmos into play and seal 1 [cultist] from the chaos bag on it. Forced - When you draw a non-[cultist] symbol token from the chaos bag: You take 1 horror. [reaction] After you draw a a non-[auto_fail] chaos token during a test: Apply the token sealed on this card to that test, as well. Release 1 [cultist] from Umbral Katadesmos and discard it.

cards.flavor: "My sister will hold your hand, and my sister will draw the last breath from your lungs. And I? It will be my hand that stills your heart."
cards.name: Milly Mercer
cards.text: Retaliate. Alert. Milly Mercer gets +X fight. X is the total number of Fog Tokens in play. Milly Mercer cannot leave Corona Heights. Forced - At the beginning of your turn, if Milly Mercer is ready and at your location: You lose 1 action. Place a Fog Token on Corona Heights.

cards.flavor: "The things we do for love..."
cards.name: Pietro Spadarotto
cards.text: Elusive. Pietro Spadarotto cannot be damaged if there are 3 or more Fog Tokens in play. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Pietro Spadarotto is ready: Put 1 fog token on the location nearest to Pietro Spadarotto without a fog token.

cards.flavor: If you will not come to it, it will come to you.
cards.name: The Pale Brown Thing
cards.text:
Hunter. 
The Pale Brown Thing gets +1 [per_investigator] health.
The Pale Brown Thing may only enter locations with Fog Tokens, and moves as if locations with Fog Tokens are connected.

cards.flavor:
"It is an odd thing, but everyone who 
disappears is said to be seen in San Francisco." 
---Oscar Wilde
cards.name: Fog-Dweller
cards.text: Spawn - Furthest location with a Fog Token from all investigators. (No enemies, if possible.) Hunter. Fog-Dweller may only enter locations with Fog Tokens, and moves as if locations with Fog Tokens are connected.

cards.flavor: Wherever she goes, shadows follow.
cards.name: Her Dark Influence
cards.text: Jinxed. Revelation - Attach Her Dark Influence to the nearest [[San Francisco]] location. Attached location gets +1 shroud for each Fog Token on it. Forced - At the end of the round, if there are no Fog Tokens on Her Dark Influence's location: Move Her Dark Influence once towards the nearest location with 1 or more Fog Tokens.

cards.flavor:
"This city is a point upon a map of fog." 
---Ambrose Bierce
cards.name: The Fog Rolls
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - You must decide (choose one):- Put a Fog Token on the closest [[San Francisco]] location without an existing Fog Token. - Put 1 Fog Token on the 2 closest [[San Francisco]] locations with at least 1 Fog Token.

cards.name: The Killer Strikes!
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - You must decide (choose one): - Put 1 doom on the agenda. This doom may cause the agenda to advance. - Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is revealed. Spawn this enemy at the closest location with a Fog Token. Repeat this process for every 2 [per_investigator] Fog Tokens in play.

cards.flavor:
If hypothetical trains can't stay on track, 
you shouldn't have expected this one to.
cards.name: Trolley Problem
cards.text: Revelation - Each investigator at a [[Rail]] location takes 1 damage. Then, put Trolley Problem into play next to the agenda deck. Investigators cannot activate [free] abilities on the Agenda. [action][action]: Discard Trolley Problem. Any investigator may trigger this ability.

cards.name: The Garden of Bones
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the current Act.
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If this skill test fails, you lose 1 action.
[tablet]: –2. If you fail, each enemy in play gets +1 fight and +1 evade until the end of the round.
[elder_thing]: –2. If you fail and this is not a fight, investigate or evade action, choose and discard 1 card from your hand.

cards.name: The Garden of Bones
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is 1 higher the current Act.
[cultist]: –1. Reveal another token. If this skill test fails, you lose 1 action.
[tablet]: –3. If you fail, each enemy in play gets +1 fight and +1 evade until the end of the round.
[elder_thing]: –3. Choose and discard 1 card from your hand.

cards.flavor:
You’ve travelled all the way to Germany, chasing after the shadow of Mater Suspiriorum: the eldest of the Three Mothers, shepherd of the despairing and forgotten. Can you find her before more of Freiburg’s broken souls take her hand and vanish into the dark? 
Or will you be the next to slip away?
cards.name: No Truce with the Furies
cards.text: (Reminder: When this agenda advances, Mater Suspiriorum will come to claim her lost children and the scenario will end.)

cards.name: In Silent Communion
cards.text:
The church bell at Freiburg Munster tolls, its deep chime cutting through the cold, misty air. Somewhere in an old, ancient abbey deep in the Black Forest, the last desperate cries of the missing townsfolk fade into silence.
You've run out of time. Each remaining investigator is defeated.

cards.flavor: People don’t just vanish into thin air. There must somewhere in the city they're being taken to, that much you're sure of. You hit the streets of the city, determined to leave no stone unturned until you find where they are going.
cards.name: One Foot on the Threshold
cards.text: Jinx -- Replenish 1 clue on The Cathedral of Our Lady (to its maximum clue value). Objective - If "you discovered the way forward," Advance.

cards.flavor:
Mild-mannered Inspector Zimmermann has served the 
Freiburg Police force faithfully for nearly twenty years. He's spent ten of those years as a faithful thrall of the Mother of Sighs.
cards.name: Inspector Zimmermann
cards.text: Spawn - Freiburg im Breisgau. Hunter. Jinxed. Inspector Zimmermann gets +1 [per_investigator] health. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Inspector Zimmermann is engaged with an investigator: Add 1 doom to the agenda.

cards.flavor: You've discovered the entrance to a twisting maze of tunnels and crypts under the Haus zum Walfisch. If the missing townspeople were spirited away through these catacombs, you have to wonder---what terrible purpose lay in wait for them, so far beneath the city?
cards.name: What Lies Beneath
cards.text: Jinx -- You take 1 horror. (Limit once per phase.) Objective - If "you unearthed a secret", advance.

cards.name: Walpurga's Road
cards.text:
After what feels like hours of trudging down the dark tunnel, a wooden hatch in the ceiling above blocks your path, its slats letting in thin streams of pale moonlight. You reach up, and with a soft creak, the hatch swings open with surprising ease. You rise up into a small courtyard: neat, quiet, and still. A vegetable garden sits off to one side; on the other, the shadow of a chapel steeple looms over the courtyard wall. You’ve surfaced inside a small abbey somewhere in the Black Forest---but why?
Remove all doom from Agenda 1a. Each investigator loses all of their clues. Put each [[Convent]] location into play. Proceed to Interlude: The Abbey of St. Walpurga.

cards.flavor: You find yourself in the Abbey of St. Walpurga, somewhere deep in the Black Forest. You're closer than ever to finding Mater Suspiriorum, but it's clearer than ever that whatever's waiting for you at journey's end will not be easy or pleasant.
cards.name: Walpurgis Night
cards.text: Jinx -- Choose one: (Limit once per round.) - Take 1 horror. - Take 1 damage. - Draw the top card of the encounter deck. Objective - Find what you came here for. You will be instructed when to advance.

cards.name: Helena
cards.text: The ladder creaks under your weight as you descend into the chamber beneath the anchoress’ cell, and a fetid stench hits you like a blow. A cavern of bones and decay stretches before you. On one side, the missing townsfolk sit huddled, silent, shaking with fear. On the other, an old nun sits with her back to you, her frail frame facing the damp stone wall. From above, a frantic voice breaks the oppressive quiet. "Please, don’t hurt her!" A young nun scrambles down after you, her eyes wide with desperation. She stumbles over her words, tears streaking her face. "I'm Sister Cassandra. Mother Helena has served this Abbey for years, taking away the suffering of all who came seeking solace. But tonight..." Her voice cracks. "Tonight, whatever divine grace filled her is gone. She doesn’t hear us, doesn’t see us---doesn’t feel anything. She’s been abandoned. Can’t you see?" The old nun doesn’t stir, even as you approach. Her body doesn’t flinch under your scrutiny. Either Sister Cassandra and Mother Helena are talented actresses both, or the truth is even more pitiful: this woman is now an empty shell. "Please," Sister Cassandra pleads, her voice raw. "Take the townsfolk and go. She may be hollow, but I can’t abandon her too---not after all she’s done for us. I owe her that much."

cards.flavor:
Mater Suspiriorum has abandoned her host. Mother Helena is an empty husk. 
You're free to take the missing townspeople. Go.
cards.name: Dawn Breaks
cards.text: [action]: Resign. You've found the missing townspeople. There's nothing more for you to do here. Jinx -- Choose one: (Limit once per round.) - Take 1 horror. - Take 1 damage. - Draw the top card of the encounter deck. Objective - If any investigator resigns: →R1. Objective - If "blood has been spilled on sacred ground", advance.

cards.name: A Dish Served Cold
cards.text:
Mother Helena crumples, her frail form still at last. A knot of emotions tightens in your chest---justice for the townsfolk you couldn’t save, grief for the innocents lost at Nussbaum Academy, and the raw sorrow of what you’ve just done. But that moment shatters once her lifeless body begins to convulse. Your heart skips as the corpse tears open, flesh and bone rending apart with sickening force. From the ruins of her form emerges a monstrous, winged figure drenched in Mother Helena's own blood. The thing unfurls herself, rising to her full height, towering and dreadful---a nightmare made flesh. Sister Cassandra’s scream cuts through the chamber, sharp and panicked. She stumbles backward toward the ladder, her voice trembling with horror. "No! I warned you! Now---Tisiphone comes!"
Put the set aside Tisiphone enemy into play at the Anchoress' Cell. Remove Agenda 1a and Act 4a from the game. Advance to Agenda 2a. It is both the current Act and Agenda.

cards.flavor: By the time you reach the Schauinsland, the twilight sky has turned dark. You're here chasing rumors about an old tunnel that connects the two neighboring villages on either side of the mountain---and perhaps to the missing townsfolk, as well. But now that you're here, trudging through damp, thick clumps of fresh snowfall, you'll be lucky if you can even find your footing.
cards.name: The Other Side of the World
cards.text: Jinx -- Put 1 clue on The Midwife's Tunnel from the token bank. Objective - If "you opened the path," Advance.

cards.name: Schiachpercht
cards.text: Spawn - The Schauinsland Jinxed. During the enemy phase, Schiachpercht is considered to be at each [[Mountain]] location. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Schiachpercht is ready and unengaged: Each investigator at a [[Hexenweg]] location triggers the current Jinx.

cards.flavor: The hidden path inside the Midwife's Tunnel spills out into a cavern so vast, it makes you forget the frozen wasteland outside. Everything’s green as far as the eye can see; a secret world locked beneath the winter frost. Someone’s been through here recently, that much is clear from the lit torches that line the stone path forward. But as for what---or who---you’ll find at its end, that’s anyone’s guess.
cards.name: Hexenweg
cards.text: Jinx -- Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, draw the top card of the encounter deck. (Limit once per round.) Objective - If "you unearthed a secret," Advance.

cards.name: Walpurga's Road
cards.text:
Around the base of the brazier lie small square stones inscribed with writing, each no larger than a notebook page. Some of the languages are indecipherable, but you identify others---English, Chinese, Latin. On inspection, it becomes obvious what the writing on these stones is: they're countless names. Zorya Utrennyaya. Su Daji. Delphine LaLaurie. Caterina Maria de' Medici. Dorothea Spitznagel. Helena Nussbaum. Thousands of them, each etched into their own stone.
The investigator who flipped over Mother's Cradle must immediately add the set-aside Katadesmos of Anima weakness to their deck. This card does not count toward that investigator's deck size.
The second your eyes pass over Helena Nussbaum's name, the stone slab at the far end of the clearing groans and grinds backward to reveal yet another dark, hidden pathway. You take a breath, but it’s already too late to turn back. You step inside. After what feels like hours of trudging down the dark tunnel, a wooden hatch in the ceiling above blocks your path, its slats letting in thin streams of pale moonlight. You reach up, and with a soft creak, the hatch swings open with surprising ease. You rise up into a small courtyard: neat, quiet, and still. A vegetable garden sits off to one side; on the other, the shadow of a chapel steeple looms over the courtyard wall. You’ve surfaced inside a small abbey somewhere in the Black Forest---but why?
Remove all doom from Agenda 1a. Each investigator loses all of their clues. Put each [[Convent]] location into play. Proceed to Interlude: The Abbey of St. Walpurga.

cards.flavor: Once you're inside the Black Forest, it becomes abundantly clear how these woods earned their name. The forest's dense canopy barely lets any sunlight pierce through. Hopefully you won't need to search long to find Mater Suspiriorum and the missing townspeople.
cards.name: Into the Woods
cards.text: Jinx -- Test [agility] (2). If you fail, disengage from all enemies at your location and immediately move to The Black Forest. Objective - If "you made a troubling discovery," Advance.

cards.name: Schrätelhexe
cards.text: Spawn - Ritual Tangle Elusive. Jinxed. Schrätelhexe gets +1 [per_investigator] health. Schrätelhexe takes 1 less damage from cards without the [[Relic]], [[Blessed]], or [[Spell]] traits. Forced - While Schrätelhexe is not engaged with an investigator, you may not trigger the veiled keyword on locations.

cards.flavor: With every step you take deeper into the Black Forest, the shadows swallow what little light remains. There's something out here, watching you---something old and malevolent.
cards.name: Dark Hearts
cards.text: Jinx -- Take 1 damage. (Limit once per phase.) Objective - If "you unearthed a secret," Advance.

cards.name: Walpurga's Road
cards.text:
After what feels like hours of trudging down the dark tunnel, a wooden hatch in the ceiling above blocks your path, its slats letting in thin streams of pale moonlight. You reach up, and with a soft creak, the hatch swings open with surprising ease. You rise up into a small courtyard: neat, quiet, and still. A vegetable garden sits off to one side; on the other, the shadow of a chapel steeple looms over the courtyard wall. You’ve surfaced inside a small abbey somewhere in the Black Forest---but why?
Remove all doom from Agenda 1a. Each investigator loses all of their clues. Put each [[Convent]] location into play. Proceed to Interlude: The Abbey of St. Walpurga.

cards.flavor:
As night falls, you can feel the city buzz with 
a curious energy, as if something unspeakable 
lies just behind its fairytale veneer.
cards.name: Freiburg im Breisgau
cards.subname: The City in the Black Forest
cards.text: [action] Choose and discard a non-weakness card from your hand: Draw 2 cards. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
The city's streets awash in the aroma of 
roasted chestnuts from market stalls and the 
earthy fragrance of centuries-old timber. 
The locals say the coming winter will be a cold one.
cards.name: Freiburg im Breisgau

cards.flavor:
Albert-Ludwigs University of Freiburg is the fifth-oldest university in all of Germany, and the first to accept 
female students. Its student dormitories are currently kept under strict curfew, given the recent disappearances.
cards.name: University of Freiburg
cards.subname: Die Wahrheit Wird Euch Frei Machen
cards.text:
Veiled.
As an additional cost to trigger the veiled keyword on this location, spend 1 resource.

cards.name: Inspector Vogel
cards.text:
It turns out you're not the only ones searching for the missing townsfolk. Near the student dormitories, you're intercepted by a young, earnest police inspector named Fritz Vogel. He’s almost too eager to question you, and your conversation quickly shifts to comparing notes. "It was late, you know?" Vogel says, recounting a young man he tailed earlier that week before he disappeared into thin air. There was something strange in the way the boy moved---like he wasn’t really there anymore, just... following something. Figured he was a drunk. Last I saw him was near the Münsterplatz. Then, gone. Vanished." Before Vogel excuses himself, he leaves an offer to meet again should your search bear any fruit. "If you find anything, let me know. If I’m off duty, Inspector Hans Zimmermann’s the man posted here. I'm sure he'll be keen to help you out."
Choose an investigator at your location to test [intellect] or [willpower] (2). If that test succeeds, remove X clues from The Cathedral of Our Lady and return them to the token bank. X is the amount the test succeeded by (to a minimum of 1.)
Flip this card back over and put 1 clue on University of Freiburg from the token bank. This card may be flipped over again.

cards.flavor:
Evening Mass is just getting underway. Maybe there’s something in today's sermon that’ll steel your nerves 
for the night ahead, if you happen to be a believer. 
If not, at least it’s warm inside.
cards.name: The Cathedral of Our Lady
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Heal 1 horror and draw a card.

cards.flavor: Built in the 16th century, The Whale House famously served as a refuge to the philosopher Erasmus as he fled the Reformation. Today, the historic building lies vacant.
cards.name: The Whale House
cards.text:
Jinxed. Veiled.
The Whale House gets +X shroud. X is the number of clues remaining on The Cathedral of Our Lady.

cards.name: The Belly of the Whale
cards.text:
It takes a while for it to click---why the Whale House feels so wrong whenever you pass it by. The stonework is older, weathered by time and neglect, but there's no mistaking it. The place is almost identical to Nussbaum Academy. The resemblance is too close to be a coincidence. Once you decide to break inside, your suspicions deepen. The layout is the same---Every hall, every corner. It's like you're walking through the same nightmare all over again. Following a hunch, you head for where the headmistress’s office would have been, and find exactly what you were looking for: a secret passage, in the exact same place you found it back at the Academy.
Each investigator loses all of their clues. Put each [[Catacomb]] location into play and shuffle the set-aside Paranormal Activity encounter set into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile. Remove all doom from Agenda 1a.
Remember that "you have found the way forward." Flip this card back over. It may not be flipped over again.

cards.flavor:
From the heights of the Schauinsland, 
Freiburg looks like a tiny toy city nestled amongst the trees.
cards.name: The Schauinsland
cards.text:
Asset and event cards cost 1 additional resource to play at this location.
Skill cards have 1 additional [wild] symbol when committed to tests at this location.

cards.flavor:
This tunnel was built to allow for passage 
between the hamlets of Kappler and Hofsgrund 
on either side of the mountain. It's been 
sealed up tight for the past several years.
cards.name: The Midwife's Tunnel
cards.text: Jinxed. Veiled. Forced - When you would discover one or more clues at The Midwife's Tunnel: Cancel that discovery.

cards.name: The Warning
cards.text:
You walk the length of the Midwife’s Tunnel twice over without finding a thing, but it's on your third pass that something truly odd occurs. A tall figure approaches you from down the long, dark tunnel, its hidden face behind a shaggy, grotesque mask. "You must decide now," the thing rasps as you draw closer. "Turn back, and you may never reach this place again. Continue, and you may be lost." You’re too stunned to respond, your words lost somewhere between disbelief and dread. The masked figure sniffs the air like a bloodhound before it resumes its slow, deliberate pace past you and down the Midwife's Tunnel. Just before it vanishes into the gloom, it offers you one final piece of advice over its shoulder: "You must not shed blood in the garden. You are warned." The encounter is over in less than a minute. As the strange figure disappears from sight, a sudden gust of wind whips through the tunnel. And then---where there was only solid rock before---a new path into the darkness lies behind you, a mouth yawning open in the stone.
Each investigator loses all of their clues. Put each [[Hexenweg]] location into play and shuffle the set-aside Agents of Tears encounter set into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile. Remove all doom from Agenda 1a.
Remember that "you opened the path." Flip this card back over. It may not be flipped over again.

cards.flavor: Zur Friedrichsruhe was originally built in the 19th century by the stage manager of Theater Freiburg. Appropriately, it's quite a dramatic sight against the backdrop of the Schauinsland's peak.
cards.name: Zur Friedrichsruhe
cards.text:
Veiled.
[free] Spend 1 resource: Search the top 3 cards of your deck for an asset and draw it. If a weakness is discovered among the searched cards, draw it as well. (Limit once per investigator.)

cards.name: Herr Blumhoff
cards.text:
