Heinrich Blumhoff, the head of staff at the Berghotel Schauinsland, frowns as you lay out your reason for coming up the mountain. "The old Midwife’s Tunnel? Locked up tight, I’m afraid. Too many young folks causing trouble---the vandalizing, drawing the rude pictures on the walls, the sneaking off to… misbehave... It’s bad for business, you understand." Well. If Herr Blumhoff’s worried about his bottom line, you’ve got a pretty good idea how to grease his wheels...
Investigators at Zur Freidrichsruhe may choose to spend any combination of 4 [per_investigator] resources or clues.
If you chose to spend the required amount of resources and/or clues: Ignore the forced text on The Midwife's Tunnel for the remainder of the game. (Place a horror token on The Midwife's Tunnel as a reminder.) Flip this card back over. This card may be flipped over again.
Otherwise, flip this card back over and put 1 clue on Zur Freidrichsruhe from the token bank. This card may be flipped over again.

cards.flavor:
There are answers to your questions, 
somewhere deep in these dark woods.
cards.name: The Black Forest
cards.text: [reaction] After you enter The Black Forest from another [[Schwarzwald]] location, test [willpower] (X). X is the number of cards in your hand. If you succeed, take an immediate move action.

cards.flavor:
As you trudge along the shore, a biting wind begins 
to pick up from the far side of the lake.
cards.name: Lake Titisee
cards.text: Jinxed. Veiled. Forced - After you move to Lake Titisee: You cannot discover more than 1 clue at this or any connecting location until the end of the round.

cards.name: Home
cards.text:
The wind picks up across the lake, carrying with it a sound: your name, whispered so faintly you almost think you imagined it. You turn instinctively, to answer the call--- And you’re home. Your childhood home. You can hear your family in the next room, chatting happily among themselves. Everything is just as you remember it, down to the smallest detail---even the smell. Emotion floods over you like a tidal wave. You run, eager to explore, to touch each familiar corner. But as you rush to start revisiting this impossible place, you pitch forward. You’ve fallen waist-deep in the icy waters of Lake Titisee, your legs sinking into the muddy depths as you stop yourself from walking toward the center of the lake. Was that a memory? Who called your name? What do you think you're doing?
Take 1 horror. You may choose to take 1 more horror. For each horror you took (to a maximum of 2), you may move a clue from a connecting location to Lake Titisee. Flip this card over. This card may be flipped over again.

cards.flavor:
The gentle sound of rushing water at the bottom of the 
gorge is certainly pleasant, but ultimately does very little to 
make navigating the cramped thicket less frustrating.
cards.name: Ravenna Gorge
cards.text:
Veiled. Jinxed.
Ravenna Gorge gets +1 shroud for each clue below its maximum clue threshold.
As an additional cost to take a move action at Ravenna Gorge, spend 1 additional action.

cards.name: The Edge of Sight
cards.text:
Thick roots and thorned bushes crowd the path at the bottom of the gorge. Somewhere far ahead of you, a figure moves---just out of reach. She slips between the trees, but not before you catch a glimpse. Could it be? She matches the description of one of the missing young women from the city. But as you round a bend in the gorge, your excitement over finding the missing girl curdles into horror. There, sprawled in the mud by the creekside, lies a skeleton. The tattered clothing draped across its bones bears an uncanny resemblance to what the missing woman had been last seen wearing. But the body---it’s wrong. The decay, the way the flesh has all but rotted away, is far more advanced than the mere days she’s been gone. It shouldn’t be possible. Before you can investigate further, the last sliver of sunlight vanishes, swallowed by the canopy overhead. In an instant, the gorge plunges into total darkness. And then, the horrible, cackling laughter begins.
Each investigator loses all of their clues. Put each [[Bannwald]] location into play and shuffle the set-aside Trauma encounter set into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile. Remove all doom from Agenda 1a.
Remember that "you made a troubling discovery." Flip this card back over. It may not be flipped over again.

cards.name: Candlelit Shrine
cards.text:
While there is a resource token, a damage token, and a horror token on this location, it gains veiled.
[action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, say a prayer at the altar and put a damage token on Candlelit Shrine.
[action]: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, search the altar for secret compartments and put a resource token on Candlelit Shrine.
[action]: Test [combat] (3). If you succeed, push the altar with all your weight to see if it can be moved and put a horror token on Candlelit Shrine.

cards.name: The Architect
cards.text:
You've pushed, prodded, and even prayed at the shrine, all to no avail. You've begun to feel a little foolish. It's only after exhausting your options that you notice the An inscription, faint and worn, etched intoe base of the shrine. You lean closer to make out the words, written in German: "Hier liegen die Überreste von Elio Varelli; Architekt des Haus zum Walfisch und lebenslanger Freund von Erasmus." "Here lie the remains of Elio Varelli; Architect of the Whale House and lifelong friend of Erasmus." Elio Varelli? Could he be related to the man who built the Hotel Seasons in Arkham? That would be a strange coincidence, indeed. Before you can make sense of it, a soft, metallic clink breaks the silence. A small object has fallen from the shrine. You kneel, fingers brushing the cold ground, and reach for it.
Choose an investigator to put the set-aside Pendant of the Antecedent into their hand. That investigator may choose to add it to their deck. This card does not count toward that investigator's deck size.

cards.flavor:
How many people had to pass on, 
just for their remains to end up in this single room?
cards.name: Forgotten Ossuary
cards.text: Jinxed. Forced - If you fail an investigate action at this location: Flip this card over. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: The Forgotten
cards.text:
As you push deeper into the winding, subterranean passages beneath Freiburg, the sounds of the city above are replaced with something altogether different---the sound of quiet whispers, too faint to understand. You had thought that you were just been hearing snippets of conversations from the town above, but as the minutes drag on, you start to see them---the silvery figures, flickering at the edge of your vision. Men, women, and children, moving like shadows in the desolate corners of the tunnels. You're trespassing in the realm of Freiburg's dead.
Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a copy of Hateful Apparition and draw it.
Flip this card back over. This card may be flipped over again.

cards.flavor: Rows of coffins line the inside of this long, dark chamber.
cards.name: Sealed Crypt
cards.text:
Jinxed. Veiled.
Sealed Crypt gets –X shroud. X is the number of failed investigation attempts at this location this round.

cards.name: Memory Eternal
cards.text:
If the investigators possess fewer than 3 [per_investigator] clues:
You take a moment to pull the cobwebs from your hair as you reach a dead end at the far side of the crypt. Maybe you missed something.
Flip this card back over and put 1 clue on Sealed Crypt from the token bank. This card may be flipped over again.
If the investigators possess 3 [per_investigator] or more clues:
Your search through the crypt yields little more than dust, until you find the sarcophagus belonging to Dorothea Spitznagel: Mother Superior of the order of St. Walpurga. You frown. Why would a nun be entombed here beneath the streets of Freiburg, rather than on consecrated ground? Especially a nun of such importance? On a hunch, you grip the edge of the heavy lid and push. The stone groans in protest, but eventually shifts. Instead of the withered remains of a centuries-dead nun, you find something far stranger: a set of stone steps, spiraling down into deeper darkness...
The investigators must spend 3 [per_investigator] clues, as a group. Remember that "you unearthed a secret." Flip this card back over. It may not be flipped over again.

cards.flavor:
A pyre burns at the center of the stone circle, 
sending tendrils of smoke coiling upward into the cavern's ceiling.
cards.name: Mother's Cradle
cards.text:
Jinxed.
[reaction] Discard a non-weakness card from your hand or play area worth a minimum of 3 resources: Put a horror token on Mother's Cradle from the token bank, as an offering.
While there are 1 [per_investigator] offerings on this location, it gains veiled.

cards.name: In Igne Veritas
cards.text:
If the investigators possess fewer than 3 [per_investigator] clues:
You stare into flames of the pyre in the middle of the clearing, waiting for... what, exactly? Something. Anything? You're starting to feel a little ridiculous.
Flip this card back over and put 1 clue on Mother's Cradle from the token bank. This card may be flipped over again.
If the investigators possess 3 [per_investigator] or more clues:
The flickering light from the pyre in the center of the clearing casts long shadows across the the earth. Your foot catches on something solid, obscured by the darkness---a half-buried root? You glance down, and you nearly leap back in shock. It's not a root, but the jagged remains of a human jawbone. The rest of the skull is still attached, half-submerged in the dusty earth, skeletal hands clawing upward like a swimmer lost beneath the surface. Before you can fully process the horror, you spot another one just a few yards away. And another. And another---dozens, no, hundreds of skeletons lie scattered across the clearing, half-buried in the mossy ground around the flame.
The investigators must spend 3 [per_investigator] clues, as a group. Remember that "you unearthed a secret." Flip this card back over. It may not be flipped over again.

cards.flavor:
At the base of the verdant island lies a massive stone disc, 
twenty-five feet tall and covered in crude, childlike paintings.
cards.name: Stone of Sacrament
cards.text:
Veiled. Jinxed.
[reaction] When you investigate this location, increase the shroud of Stone of Sacrament by 2 for this attempt: Look at the top card of either the encounter deck or any player deck. You may choose to put that card on the bottom of its deck.

cards.name: The Crossroads Painting
cards.text:
In the center of the disk, a massive tree rises from the earth. On the disc's outer ring, a city rises from the ground---wattled huts stand aside structures shockingly similar to the Bavarian tinder-framed buildings found throughout Freiburg, behind which rise a series of tall, gray towers studded with empty windows. A lone bird flies between the city and a bleak expanse littered with supine stick figures, strewn like fallen leaves. And there, at the other end of the outer ring, stands a featureless gray figure with three heads, its right arm raised in salutation. Something about the figure feels wrong, almost threatening, threatening, and the longer you stare at it, the more your discomfort grows. It is then that you see it: the small stone carving at the base of the giant disc. It's almost identical to the figure.
Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 1 mental trauma.
Whether you succeeded or failed at the test above, choose an investigator to put the set-aside Triad Figurine into their hand. That investigator may choose to add it to their deck. This card does not count toward that investigator's deck size.

cards.flavor:
A long stone path stretches out toward a grassy hillside, 
across a still body of water. It's hard to believe this calm green sanctuary exists beneath the Schauinsland.
cards.name: The Witch's Way
cards.text: Jinxed. Forced - When you attempt to leave The Witch's Way, if there are any clues remaining on it: Test [willpower] or [agility] (3). If you fail, flip this card over and resolve the text on its other side.

cards.name: A Voice on the Wind
cards.text:
It's hard to tell where the sounds are coming from, but you’re almost sure you heard someone whisper your own name. You glance around the cavern, checking to see if you've been followed. Nothing. Not a living soul in sight---until your eyes land on a raven, perched on a nearby rock, busy picking apart the remains of an unlucky rat. Its beak works with a grim efficiency. And then, as if sensing your gaze, the bird's cold, black eyes meet yours. Without warning, it lets out a sharp cry and swoops straight at you.
Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Weeping Familiar enemy and draw it.
Flip this card back over. This card may be flipped over again.

cards.flavor:
The Bannwalds---"Protected Woods"---used to be where 
princes and dukes claimed parts of the forest as their personal hunting grounds. But Bannwald Feldberg earned its name 
for another reason: everyone knows these woods are bewitched.
cards.name: Bannwald Feldberg
cards.text: Jinxed. Forced - If you fail an fight, evade or parley action at this location: Flip this card over. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: They Follow
cards.text:
Movement flickers at the edges of your vision---hazy, indistinct shadows that slip through the trees. Whatever they are, they don’t approach, instead merely lingering on the periphery of your vision. There must be a dozen of them, maybe more, but in the dim light it's impossible to tell for sure.
Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a copy of Grasping Shadow and spawn it at a connecting location. Flip this card back over. This card may be flipped over again.

cards.flavor:
Almost all the walls of this old monastery 
have crumbled to dust. What little remains behind 
has all but been reclaimed by the forest.
cards.name: Forsaken Chantry
cards.text: Veiled. Forced - After successfully investigating Forsaken Chantry, test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). If you fail, you must immediately move to a connecting location.

cards.name: Silentium
cards.text:
If the investigators possess fewer than 3 [per_investigator] clues:
You pull yourself out of the dense treeline, only to arrive at the ruins of the old chapel for the fourth---no, fifth time. You're going in circles.
Flip this card back over and put 1 clue on Forsaken Chantry from the token bank. This card may be flipped over again.
If the investigators possess 3 [per_investigator] or more clues:
You trace your fingers along the weathered stone, brushing centuries of dirt from the inscription on the chapel's crumbling outer wall. The carved stone reveals a single Latin word carved into the stone: "Silentium." Inside the dilapidated old church, you crouch down to brush away debris from the base of where the altar must have once stood, and there it is: a faint seam in the stone, hidden in plain sight. With a soft groan, the passage opens, revealing a stairway spiraling down into darkness.
The investigators must spend 3 [per_investigator] clues, as a group. Remember that "you unearthed a secret." Flip this card back over. It may not be flipped over again.

cards.flavor:
It looks like folks have been leaving offerings in this 
shadowy thicket for ages---trinkets, tokens. Little gifts.
You could leave something of your own, if you'd like.
cards.name: Ritual Tangle
cards.text:
Veiled. Jinxed.
[action]: Exile a single card in your deck worth a minimum of 3 experience. Defeat the Schrätelhexe. (Limit once per scenario.)

cards.name: The Vanished
cards.text:
It’s deep within the thicket, nestled among the gnarled trees and tangled vines, that you find the first of the statues. The figure is life-sized and carved from a pale gray marble with an odd, slick texture. The subject, a young woman in a flapper's dress, seems frozen in terror. Around a tree, another statue awaits---a young man in policeman’s garb, his hand half-raised in some futile gesture of defense. And deeper still, you find another---a little girl, barely ten, her body contorted as if caught in mid-scream. Are these merely statues? Or were these victims of the Schrätelhexe---or something worse? Something by the little girl's feet glints in the faint light. You stoop to claim it.
Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 1 mental trauma.
Whether you succeeded or failed at the test above, choose an investigator to put the set-aside Frau Perchta's Knife into their hand. That investigator may choose to add it to their deck. This card does not count toward that investigator's deck size.

cards.flavor:
Hundreds of stone statues surround the marble figure 
atop the altar. You know who she is meant to be.
cards.name: The Altar of Sighs
cards.text:
Jinxed.
[action]: Add 1 doom to the agenda. This doom may cause the agenda to advance. Discover all clues at The Altar of Sighs. (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
This smaller chapel is housed entirely in a 
thin tower spire attached to the rear of the Abbey.
cards.name: The Marian Spire

cards.flavor: Inside the hole, the sheer number of bones is staggering---piles upon piles, more than you’ve ever seen in one place. The smell of decay in the air is overwhelming.
cards.name: Anchoress' Cell
cards.text: Jinxed. Forced - When Anchoress' Cell is revealed: Put the set-aside Mother Helena card into play at this location and advance to Act 3b.

cards.flavor:
Within the cell, a faint, uneven sound rises 
from a depression dug into the dirt floor---
like someone struggling for breath.
cards.name: Anchoress' Cell
cards.text: As an additional cost to enter the Anchoress' Cell, the investigators must spend 2 [per_investigator] clues as a group and must have "found the key to the anchorite cells."

cards.name: Scriptorium
cards.text: [action]: Search the top 6 cards of your deck for a [[Tome]] or [[Spell]] card. You may draw that card or play it, paying its cost. (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor: Each wooden desk is meticulously arranged, and the faint scent of beeswax and dried herbs hangs in the air.
cards.name: Scriptorium
The Abbey of St. Walpurga
cards.text: Each [[Humanoid]] enemy at The Abbey of St. Walpurga gets –1 fight and +2 evade.

cards.flavor:
It's been a long journey, but you have arrived at 
the Abbey of St. Walpurga, hidden 
somewhere deep within the Black Forest.
cards.name: The Abbey of St. Walpurga

cards.flavor:
There is something elegant and haunting about 
the way the moonlight shines through the 
chapel's windows---even now, amidst all this sorrow.
cards.name: St. Walpurga's Chapel
cards.text: You get –1 to fight, evade and parley tests at St. Walpurga's Chapel unless you control a card with the [[Blessed]] trait.

cards.flavor:
Time and neglect have left their mark 
on the abbey, but even they cannot entirely strip away 
the unsettling beauty of this hidden place.
cards.name: St. Walpurga's Chapel

cards.flavor: This ancient dagger smells rotten, like old fish and spoiled food. And something else, something dusty---straw, perhaps?
cards.name: Frau Perchta's Knife
cards.text: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack and deal +1 damage. If this attack defeats an enemy, you may exhaust Frau Perchta's Knife to play an event card from your hand or discard pile, paying its cost. After that event resolves, remove it from the game.

cards.flavor: An inscription on the reverse side of the seated figure reads: Κουροτρόφος, Κροκόπεπλος, Σωτηρία.
cards.name: Pendant of the Antecedent
cards.text:
You get +1 [willpower].
[reaction] At the end of the investigation phase, take 1 horror and exhaust Pendant of the Antecedent: Disengage from all enemies at your location. Enemies disengaged from in this way cannot engage you again until the beginning of the round.

cards.flavor: The tiny icon you discovered in the Hexenweg thrums in your hand, guiding you forward---but toward what, you can't be sure.
cards.name: Triad Figurine
cards.text:
Jinxed.
[reaction] When you initiate an investigate action, exhaust Triad Figurine and choose a revealed location connected to your current location: Move a clue from that location to your location. You get +2 to this investigation attempt.

cards.flavor: "...submit ...this binding, one after ... until the moons are forgotten...."
cards.name: Katadesmos of Anima
cards.text: Revelation - Put Katadesmos of Anima into play and seal 1 [tablet] from the chaos bag on it. Forced - When you draw a non-[tablet] symbol token from the chaos bag: You take 1 horror. [reaction] After you draw a a non-[auto_fail] chaos token during a test: Apply the token sealed on this card to that test, as well. Release 1 [tablet] from Katadesmos of Anima and discard it.

cards.flavor:
The old nun sits placidly amidst the muck and gloom, 
a quiet spectator to the death surrounding her. 
Her sad, haunted expression remains unchanged.
cards.name: Mother Helena
cards.subname: Helena Nussbaum, Mother of the Black Forest Convent
cards.text: Aloof. Forced - If Mother Helena is added to the victory display: Remember that "blood has been spilled on hallowed ground."

cards.flavor:
The former acting Headmistress of Nussbaum Academy wields a long, slender blade in her hand 
as she advances upon you.
cards.name: Madame Pappenheimer
cards.text: Hunter. Forced - If Madame Pappenheimer is in play or the victory display: Sister Ingrid and Sister Brigitte lose aloof and gain hunter.

cards.name: Sister Brigitte
cards.text: Aloof. Jinxed. Elusive. [reaction] If you evade Sister Brigitte by 2 or more or Sister Brigitte is defeated: Remember that "you found the key to the anchorite cells."

cards.name: Sister Ingrid
cards.text: Aloof. Jinxed. Retaliate. Forced - If Sister Ingrid is ready and a clue is discovered at her location: Put 1 doom on Sister Ingrid.

cards.flavor:
"Grief went as her companion, along with 
Terror, Fear, and twitching Madness."
---Ovid, Metamorphoses Book IV.
cards.name: Tisiphone
cards.text: Hunter. Massive. Jinxed. Prey - Lowest remaining health. Tisiphone gets +2 [per_investigator] health.

cards.name: Binding Incantation
cards.text: Jinxed. Revelation - Put Binding Incantation into play in your threat area. Forced - After you investigate: You cannot take move actions for the remainder of the round. [reaction] At the end of your turn, test [willpower] (4). If you succeed, discard Binding Incantation. You may take 1 direct damage to automatically succeed this test.

cards.flavor: You can feel the weariness settle on you like dust. All this sadness has been almost too much to bear.
cards.name: Weltschmerz
cards.text: Revelation - Put Weltschmerz into play in your threat area. Forced - When you activate a [action] ability on an asset under your control: Lose 1 action. [free]: Take 1 direct horror. Discard Weltschmerz.

cards.name: A Chorus of Suffering
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the current level of The Deluge.
[cultist]: –X. X is the number of resource tokens on the [[Chorus]] enemy with the least resource tokens.
[tablet]: –1. If you fail and are currently in control of a [[Burden]] weakness, attach that card to the nearest location without an attached [[Burden]] weakness.
[elder_thing]: –3. If you fail, put a resource token on a [[Chorus]] enemy in The Depths.

cards.name: A Chorus of Suffering
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X 1 higher than the current level of The Deluge.
[cultist]: –X. X is the number of resource tokens on the [[Chorus]] enemy with the most resource tokens.
[tablet]: –3. If you fail and are currently in control of a [[Burden]] weakness, attach that card to the nearest location without an attached [[Burden]] weakness.
[elder_thing]: –3. Put a resource token on a [[Chorus]] enemy in play. If you cannot, put a resource token on a [[Chorus]] enemy in The Depths.

cards.flavor:
In the dark, her station keeping, 
stands the mournful Mother weeping.
For all the days that we may live.
cards.name: Threnody for Our Lady: First Verse
cards.text: [action]: If a face down [[Burden]] weakness is attached to your location, spend any combination of 1 [per_investigator] clues or resources: Draw it. Jinx -- Test [agility] (2). This test gets +X Difficulty, where X is the current level of The Deluge. If you fail, put 1 resource token (from the token bank) on the [[Chorus]] enemy with the least amount of resource tokens. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: First Verse
cards.text:
The waters surge around your knees, and Amalia's song grows ever louder. How will you escape from this terrible nightmare?
Find the [[Chorus]] enemy in The Depths with the least amount of resource tokens, and spawn it in the location where the investigators began at this level of The Deluge.

cards.flavor:
Through her heart, your sorrow sharing,
All your bitter anguish bearing,
Now at last, all life has passed.
cards.name: Threnody for Our Lady: Second Verse
cards.text: [action]: If a face down [[Burden]] weakness is attached to your location, spend any combination of 1 [per_investigator] clues or resources: Draw it. Jinx -- Test [agility] (3). This test gets +X Difficulty, where X is the current level of The Deluge. If you fail, put 1 resource token (from the token bank) on the [[Chorus]] enemy with the least amount of resource tokens. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Second Verse
cards.text:
Chased by the shadowy sirens that lie beneath the waves, you push yourself harder against the tide. If only there was some sign, anything at all, that might help you find your way out of this horrible place?
Find the [[Chorus]] enemy in The Depths with the least amount of resource tokens, and spawn it in the location where the investigators began at this level of The Deluge. The Lead investigator must decide: - Listen to Amalia's lyrics, there might be something useful hidden in them. Attach the [[Burden]] Weakness nearest to your location not at The Monument to the Mother to The Monument to the Mother. Put 1 resource token on each [[Chorus]] enemy. - Tell everyone to shut out Amalia's voice! You suffer no effects.

cards.flavor:
Can the human heart refrain
From partaking in her pain?
Let us share her grief divine.
cards.name: Threnody for Our Lady: Third Verse
cards.text: [action]: If a face down [[Burden]] weakness is attached to your location, spend any combination of 1 [per_investigator] clues or resources: Draw it. Jinx -- Test [agility] (X). X is the current level of The Deluge. If you fail, put 1 resource token (from the token bank) on the [[Chorus]] enemy with the least amount of resource tokens. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Third Verse
cards.text:
A sudden riptide sweeps you onward, and you search for purchase among the rungs of a sunken balcony. Suddenly, a tug at your ankle pulls you below---one of the sirens has grabbed hold of you!
Find the [[Chorus]] enemy in The Depths with the least amount of resource tokens, and spawn it in the location where the investigators began at this level of The Deluge. Find the investigator with the lowest [agility] in play. That investigator may spend any combination of 4 resources or clues. If they do not, the Rhine Maidens pull that investigator beneath the waves; that investigator manages to free themself, but suffers 1 physical trauma.

cards.flavor:
Is there one who would not weep,
‘Whelmed in mysteries so deep?
Let us give our final breath.
cards.name: Threnody for Our Lady: Chorus
cards.text: [action]: If a face down [[Burden]] weakness is attached to your location, spend any combination of 1 [per_investigator] clues or resources: Draw it. Forced - After an this Agenda reaches an odd amount of doom: Spawn the [[Chorus]] enemy in The Depths with the least amount of resources on them at The Monument to the Mother. If you cannot, the first treachery drawn during the mythos phase gains Surge. Jinx -- Test [agility] (X). X is the current level of The Deluge. If you fail, locate the enemy in The Depths with the lowest amount of resource tokens and spawn her in your threat area. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Chorus
cards.text:
Amalia's voice rises, a siren's wail building to a piercing crescendo that reverberates through every crumbling corner of the sinking theatre. The Rhine Maidens join in, creating a chaotic, haunting melody that threatens to drive you mad.
Find each enemy in The Depths and spawn it in the location where the investigators began at this level of The Deluge. Each investigator must test [willpower] (3). Each investigator that fails this test must search the collection for a random [[Madness]] weakness and immediately add it to their deck. This card does not count toward their deck size.

cards.flavor:
While my body here decays,
May my soul her weeping praise.
Safe in sorrow, eternally.
cards.name: Threnody for Our Lady: Grand Finale
cards.text: [action]: If a face down [[Burden]] weakness is attached to your location, spend any combination of 1 [per_investigator] clues or resources: Draw it. Forced - After doom is placed on this agenda: Spawn the [[Chorus]] enemy in The Depths with the least amount of resources on them at the Monument to the Mother. If you cannot, the first treachery drawn during the mythos phase gains Surge. Jinx -- Test [agility] (X). X is the current level of The Deluge. If you fail, locate the enemy in The Depths with the lowest amount of resource tokens and spawn her in your threat area. If you cannot, the nearest [[Chorus]] enemy attacks you. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Grand Finale
cards.text:
The Theatre reverberates as the flood reaches its apex. You are washed away, pulled beneath the rising tide. And even now, as you sink, drowning in the grief-stricken waters of Mater Lachrymarum's world, Amalia's song continues.
Each remaining investigator is defeated.

cards.flavor: As the waters climb higher and higher, the Teatro di San Carlo slowly sinks beneath the waves. Amalia Verdi's haunting song drifts from somewhere deep within the opera house, undeterred by the rising tide. Maybe you're not much of an opera fan after all.
cards.name: Ocean of Tears
cards.text: Forced - If a [[Chorus]] enemy would be defeated, put 1 resource token on her, heal all damage from her and and return her to The Depths instead. All [[Chorus]] enemies gets +1 fight, +1 health, and +1 evade for each resource token on them. Objective - If there are 1+X [[Burden]] weaknesses at The Monument to the Mother, you may spend the requisite amount of clues as a group to advance. X is the current Deluge level. (Beware---any investigator not at The Monument to the Mother will be defeated.)

cards.name: The Rain, Unending
cards.text:
You lay down your burdens before the statue. There's a sudden flash of blinding light, and when your sight returns, the churning waters have receded slightly---but outside, the rain pounds down harder than ever.
Set each location in play aside, out of play. Investigators are not defeated during this process. Move each [[Chorus]] enemy in play to The Depths. Shuffle each other enemy back into the encounter deck. (If an enemy weakness is in play, place it on top of its investigator's deck, face down.) Increase the Deluge level by 1. If the current Deluge level is 4 or higher, put the Sunken Theatre location into play face up and spawn Amalia Verdi at the Sunken Theatre. Then, perform the following: - Each investigator who is not at The Monument to the Mother is swallowed by the rising tide and is defeated. Each surviving investigator loses each of their clues. - Shuffle each [[Burden]] weakness in play back into the Deck of Burdens. - Draw a random set-aside location other than The Monument to the Mother, put it into play, and place each surviving investigator at that location. - Put The Monument to the Mother and 4 other random set-aside locations into play, face up. Attach a card from the Deck of Burdens to each location other than The Monument to the Mother, face down. - If Amalia Verdi is in play, advance to both set aside versions of Act 2. Both are in play. - Otherwise, flip this act back over. Continue your escape from the Teatro di San Carlo.

cards.flavor: Amalia emerges onto the sunken stage, a blurry figure amidst all the rain. A terrible, desperate realization settles over you. Amalia must be under the sway of Mater Lachrymarum, or perhaps something worse-- a willing vessel for the Mother of Tears herself. If you want to survive this night, you know what you have to do.
cards.name: Coda: The Exit Aria
cards.text: Forced - If a [[Chorus]] enemy would be defeated, put 1 resource token on her, heal all damage from her and and return her to The Depths instead. All [[Chorus]] enemies gets +1 fight, +1 health, and +1 evade for each resource token on them. Objective - If Amalia Verdi is defeated: Advance.

cards.name: The Rain, Ending
cards.text:
Amalia falls backward into the churning waves. The siren song dies in her throat, cut off mid-note, her face frozen in an expression of agony and disbelief. Then, almost instantly, the theatre begins to buckle, collapsing under the weight of the endless rain. Like a rat scrambling to escape a sinking ship, you claw toward the exits, driven by sheer panic as the waves beat against your body. Each step forward feels like a futile struggle, the knowledge gnawing at you that beyond the theatre doors lies only more of this watery nightmare---a city swallowed whole by the sea. but as you burst through, gasping for air, you stumble out onto the street. The rain has stopped, the air is warm, and the city is unchanged. The Teatro di San Carlo stands behind you, proud and gleaming in the light of a rising sun. The horror has vanished, and yet, your freedom tastes bitter---like your survival is a cruel joke.
→R2

cards.flavor:
Desperation and panic are causing you to lose your wits, to doubt yourself. 
Amalia has to be a prisoner of Mater Lachrymarum-- a victim of forces out of her control, like you. Maybe you haven't given enough of yourself to the Mother of Tears. Maybe you can convince her that you deserve to live.
cards.name: Coda: Catharsis
cards.text: Objective - If 1 [per_investigator]+1 [[Burden]] weaknesses are attached to The Monument of the Mother: Advance.

cards.name: The Pain, Unending
cards.text:
Your worst memories rise unbidden. The sorrows that shaped you, the regret that has followed you for years: they are the price of your freedom. Slowly, you release them. One by one, your memories slip away, carried by the surging tide. Each one leaves you a little lighter, but so too do you feel the shape of their absence as they are stolen away to be woven into this realm's endless tapestry of sorrow. And then, you are standing at center stage of the Teatro di San Carlo, restored and pristine. Amalia gasps for breath on her hands and knees before you, wide-eyed with wonder and disbelief. You've all escaped-- but something of you remains behind, taken by the Mother of Tears.
→R1.

cards.name: Sunken Theatre
cards.text:
Jinxed.
[free] Play a card from your hand, paying its cost. (Max once per game per player.)
[free] If The Deluge is level 4 or higher: Read Vision IV in the campaign guide (page 36.)

cards.name: The Monument to the Mother
cards.text: Jinxed. You may attach any number of [[Burden]] weaknesses to The Monument to the Mother. The Monument to the Mother gets +X shroud. X is the number of [[Burden]] weaknesses attached to this location. Forced - After a [[Burden]] weakness is attached to this location: Replenish clues on The Monument to the Mother to its maximum clue value.

cards.flavor:
The backstage of the opera house crumbled 
under the pounding rain long, long ago.
cards.name: Backstage Cenote
cards.text:
[free] Discard 1+X cards from your hand or play area: Draw the [[Burden]] attached to this location. X is the level of The Deluge.
[free] If The Deluge is level 1 or higher: Read Vision I in the campaign guide (page 36.)

cards.name: Drained Arcade
cards.text: Forced - If a [[Chorus]] enemy would enter or spawn at Drained Arcade: Disengage that enemy from all investigators and move her to a connecting location. If you cannot, move her to the Depths, instead. [free] Locate the enemy in the Depths with the least amount of resource tokens on her and spawn her at a connecting location. Draw the [[Burden]] attached to this location.

cards.name: Drowned Foyer
cards.text: Forced - If a [[Chorus]] enemy is at this or a connecting location, you may not investigate the Drowned Foyer or draw [[Burden]] cards attached to it. [action]: If there is no face down [[Burden]] card attached to this location, choose one attached to another location and attach it to the Drowned Foyer, instead. (Limit once per level of The Deluge.)

cards.name: Collapsing Tearoom
cards.text: Forced - When Collapsing Tearoom enters play, put X clues on it. X is the current level of The Deluge.

cards.name: Grand Staircase
cards.text: Forced - When your turn begins, if you are at this location: When your turn ends, if you are at this location and the level of The Deluge has not increased, you take 3 damage.

cards.flavor: Unfortunately, it looks like the orchestra is still in here.
cards.name: Orchestra Pit
cards.text:
Jinxed.
[free] Reveal the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. Choose 1 to draw and discard the others. Then, draw the face down [[Burden]] attached to this location. 
[free] If The Deluge is level 2 or higher: Read Vision II in the campaign guide (page 36.)

cards.name: Submerged Chamber
cards.text:
[action]: Search the top 9 cards of your deck for a [[Tome]], [[Spell]] or [[Song]] card and add it to your hand. (Limit once per level of The Deluge.)
[free] If The Deluge is level 3 or higher: Read Vision III in the campaign guide (page 36.)

cards.name: Sinking Flight
cards.text:
Jinxed.
If you trigger a Jinx while at Sinking Flight, test 
[agility] (2). If you succeed, cancel the effects of that Jinx. If you fail, take 1 damage.

cards.name: Whitewater Hallways
cards.text: [free] Test [agility] (2). If The Deluge is level 2 or higher, this gets +X difficulty. X is the level of The Deluge. If you succeed, draw the [[Burden]] attached to this location. Otherwise, take 1 damage.

cards.flavor: You were so happy when the visions finally left. You hoped they'd never come back.
cards.name: Delirium
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Delirium to your location. Forced - At the end of your turn, if Delirium is under your control: Either take 1 horror or discard 2 random cards from your hand. [free] If this card is attached to your location: Add Delirium to your play area. (Maximum 1 [[Burden]] per investigator.) [action] If this card is in your play area: Attach Delirium to your location. (Maximum 1 [[Burden]] per location.)

cards.flavor:
No matter how hard you try, 
you've always wondered---does any of this even matter?
cards.name: Despair
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Despair to your location. Forced - At the end of your turn, if Despair is under your control: Either take 1 horror or discard an asset under your control. [free] If this card is attached to your location: Add Despair to your play area. (Maximum 1 [[Burden]] per investigator.) [action] If this card is in your play area: Attach Despair to your location. (Maximum 1 [[Burden]] per location.)

cards.flavor: Do you remember how it sounded when they all laughed at you? Did they ever stop?
cards.name: Humiliation
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Humiliation to your location. Forced - At the end of your turn, if Humiliation is under your control: Either take 1 damage or resolve the hunter keyword on the nearest eligible enemy in play. [free] If this card is attached to your location: Add Humiliation to your play area. (Maximum 1 [[Burden]] per investigator.) [action] If this card is in your play area: Attach Humiliation to your location. (Maximum 1 [[Burden]] per location.)

cards.flavor: You remember how far they chased you. You thought you'd shaken them for good.
cards.name: Pursued
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Pursued to your location. Forced - At the end of your turn, if Pursued is under your control: Either take 1 horror or resolve the hunter keyword on the nearest eligible enemy in play. [free] If this card is attached to your location: Add Pursued to your play area. (Maximum 1 [[Burden]] per investigator.) [action] If this card is in your play area: Attach Pursued to your location. (Maximum 1 [[Burden]] per location.)

cards.flavor: You miss them every day. It never gets easier.
cards.name: Mourning
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Mourning to your location. Forced - At the end of your turn, if Mourning is under your control: Either take 1 damage or discard 2 random cards from your hand. [free] If this card is attached to your location: Add Mourning to your play area. (Maximum 1 [[Burden]] per investigator.) [action] If this card is in your play area: Attach Mourning to your location. (Maximum 1 [[Burden]] per location.)

cards.flavor: You didn't always sleep so soundly. Don't you remember?
cards.name: Nightmares
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Nightmares to your location. Forced - At the end of your turn, if Nightmares is under your control: Either take 1 horror or draw the top card of the encounter deck. [free] If this card is attached to your location: Add Nightmares to your play area. (Maximum 1 [[Burden]] per investigator.) [action] If this card is in your play area: Attach Nightmares to your location. (Maximum 1 [[Burden]] per location.)

cards.flavor: You were so ill before. What if it happens again; if it's worse this time?
cards.name: Sickness
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Sickness to your location. Forced - At the end of your turn, if Sickness is under your control: Either take 1 damage or draw the top card of the encounter deck. [free] If this card is attached to your location: Add Sickness to your play area. (Maximum 1 [[Burden]] per investigator.) [action] If this card is in your play area: Attach Sickness to your location. (Maximum 1 [[Burden]] per location.)

cards.flavor: You didn't mean to lose control. You were just so angry.
cards.name: Urges
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Urges to your location. Forced - At the end of your turn, if Urges is under your control: Either take 1 damage or discard an asset under your control. [free] If this card is attached to your location: Add Urges to your play area. (Maximum 1 [[Burden]] per investigator.) [action] If this card is in your play area: Attach Urges to your location. (Maximum 1 [[Burden]] per location.)

cards.flavor:
"If you're gonna be two-faced, sweetheart, 
you should at least make one of 'em pretty."
cards.name: Gigi Giuliano
cards.text:
You get +1 [willpower] and +1 [agility].
[reaction] When you take a [willpower] test on a treachery card, exhaust Gigi Giuliano: Reduce the difficulty of that test by 2. If you succeed, gain 1 resource. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
Giuseppe Verdi's operatic retelling of 1282's bloody Night of Sicilian Vespers is seldom staged in the contemporary theatre, largely due to 
the dreadful curse said to befall those who hear it performed.
cards.name: I Vespri Siciliani
cards.text: Uses (3 Charges.) [action]: Fight. You may use [willpower] instead of [combat] for this attack and you get +2. This attack does +1 damage. If this attack defeats an enemy, you may choose to put 1 doom on this card or take 1 horror. If you do, replenish 1 charge on I Vespri Siciliani.

cards.flavor: "...my daughter and the sage, offered freely... by law of exchange.... inherit---"
cards.name: Amaranthine Katadesmos
cards.text: Revelation - Put Amaranthine Katadesmos into play and seal 1 [elder_thing] from the chaos bag on it. Forced - When you draw a non-[elder_thing] symbol token from the chaos bag: You take 1 horror. [reaction] After you draw a non-[auto_fail] chaos token during a test: Apply the token sealed on this card to that test, as well. Release 1 [elder_thing] from Amaranthine Katadesmos and discard it.

cards.name: Flosshilde
cards.text: Hunter. Jinxed. Forced - When Flosshilde exits the Depths: Each investigator must either discard X cards from their hand or play area, or Flosshilde makes an immediate attack against them (regardless of her location.) X is the number of resource tokens on Flosshilde.

cards.name: Wellgunde
cards.text: Hunter. Jinxed. Forced - When Wellgunde exits the Depths: Each investigator must either pay X resources, or Wellgunde makes an immediate attack against them (regardless of her location.) X is the number of resource tokens on Wellgunde.

cards.name: Woglinde
cards.text: Hunter. Jinxed. Forced - When Woglinde exits the Depths: Each investigator must remove the top X non-weakness cards of their deck from the game, or Woglinde makes an immediate attack against them (regardless of her location.) X is the number of resource tokens on Woglinde.

cards.flavor:
"Alas! No comfort I impart,
nay, rather this my vain regret:
But rends still more thy sorrowful heart
And makes thy death more bitter yet."
cards.name: Amalia Verdi
cards.text: Jinxed. Forced - If Amalia Verdi is ready: You may not play or commit cards to tests at Amalia Verdi's location.

cards.flavor:
"In vain, for a moment in your arms,
I dreamed of my pitiful love."
---Antonín Dvořák, Rusalka
cards.name: Rusalka
cards.text: Hunter. Elusive. Jinxed. Spawn - Connecting Location (Empty, if Possible) Forced - When Rusalka engages you: Attach any [[Burden]] weaknesses in your threat area to the nearest location other than The Monument to the Mother without an attached [[Burden]].

cards.flavor:
"She laughed and danced, 
with the thought of death in her heart."
---Hans Christian Andersen, The Little Mermaid
cards.name: Sirène
cards.text: Retaliate. Spawn - The Depths. Forced - If Sirène is in the Depths and a resource token is placed on a [[Chorus]] enemy: Put 1 doom on Sirène and put her into play at the furthest location from all investigators.

cards.flavor:
"Where sorrow dwells in the heart,
never can peace reign there again."
---Albert Lortzing, Undine
cards.name: Undine
cards.text: Aloof. Retaliate. Forced - Increase the shroud of Undine's location by X. X is the current level of The Deluge.

cards.name: Anathema
cards.text: Revelation - You must attach Anathema to either the current agenda or the current act. Limit 1 per agenda/act. While Anathema is in play, increase the shroud of each location by 1. Forced - At the end of the round, if you are at a location with a shroud of 5 or higher: Take 1 horror.

cards.name: Dissolution
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (2). This test gets +X difficulty, where X is the current Agenda. If you fail, choose 1:- Find the [[Chorus]] enemy in the Depths with the least resource tokens on her. Put 1 resource token on her. - Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy or a [[Terror]] is revealed.Draw that card.

cards.flavor:
The price of your past mistakes is high---
but is it too much to pay?
cards.name: Drowned in Sorrows
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - If you do not control a [[Burden]] asset, discard Drowned in Sorrows. Otherwise, attach your [[Burden]] asset to the nearest location other than The Monument to the Mother without an attached [[Burden]].

cards.flavor:
"But a mermaid has no tears, 
and therefore she suffers so much more."
---Hans Christian Andersen, The Little Mermaid
cards.name: Flood of Grief
cards.text: Revelation - Test any skill (1). This test gets +X difficulty, where X is the current level of The Deluge. If you fail, take 1 damage and 1 horror. Regardless of whether you succeeded or failed, if you chose a skill with a value of 4 or higher: Lose 1 action.

cards.name: Full Fathom Five
cards.text: Revelation - If there are no [[Chorus]] enemies in the Depths, Full Fathom Five gains surge. Otherwise, find the [[Chorus]] enemy in the Depths with the least amount of resource tokens on her and spawn her engaged with you. Then, if there are any other [[Chorus]] enemies not in the Depths, choose one of them and move her to the Depths.

cards.name: Mother's Mercy
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is half the number of cards tucked beneath the Act deck, rounded up. 
[cultist]: –2. If you fail, ready the nearest exhausted enemy in play.
[tablet]: –3. You may discard a random card from your hand to treat this token as a –1.
[elder_thing]: –2. If you fail, resolve the current Jinx. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Mother's Mercy
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is the number of cards tucked beneath the Act deck. 
[cultist]: –4. If you fail, ready the nearest exhausted enemy in play.
[tablet]: –5. You may discard a random card from your hand to treat this token as a –2.
[elder_thing]: –3. Resolve the current Jinx. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
I know them thoroughly, and have walked in all their kingdoms. Three sisters they are, of one mysterious household; and their paths are wide apart; but of their dominion there is no end.
---Thomas de Quincey, Levana and Our Ladies of Sorrow
cards.name: The Palace of Sorrows
Encroaching Shadow
cards.text:
The sadness here is palpable, filling your mind with distant regrets you can’t quite name. Every surface, every shadowed alcove, feels like it’s mired in centuries of regret and pain. If you look hard enough, there are figures in the shadows---flitting, scared things, that flee from sight quicker than you can register them. But occasionally, one of them lingers, its outline rippling like smoke caught in a draft, and the weight of its anguished presence chills you to your core.
In player order, each investigator must discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a card from the Tenebrae, Trauma, or Phenomena encounter sets is revealed and resolve its effects. Cards from these encounter sets are indicated by the following icons: Afterward, shuffle the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor:
They wheeled in mazes; I spelled the steps. They telegraphed from afar; I read the signals. They conspired together; and on the mirrors of darkness my eye traced the plots.
---Thomas de Quincey, Levana and Our Ladies of Sorrow
cards.name: Empire of Sorrow
Encroaching Shadow
cards.text:
The shadows stretch toward you from the far end of the hall. They move like silk dragged through water, slow but deliberate. You can hear them giggling.
In player order, each investigator must discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[Geist]] or [[Witch]] enemy is revealed and draw that card. Afterward, shuffle the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor:
Through us do you know fear.
Through us it was, by languishing desires, that you worshipped and prayed to the wormy grave. Holy was the grave to you; lovely was its darkness; saintly its corruption.
Yes, you, young coward. 
We take you now to our heart, and season you for what is to come.
Banish the frailties of hope.
Wither the relenting of love.
We curse you as only we can curse.
cards.name: Three Anguishes
Three Dooms
cards.text: Each investigator is defeated.

cards.flavor: Maddalena strides confidently forward through the Palace of Sorrows, but there's a hungry urgency for whatever comes next in her pace. If you don't keep up, she's likely to leave you behind.
cards.name: Promises to Keep
cards.text: [action] Investigators at your location spend 1 [per_investigator]+X clues, as a group: Parley. Flip over a [[Bound]] story asset at your location and resolve the story text on that card's reverse side. X is the number of resource tokens on that story asset. Jinx -- Find the [[Bound]] story asset closest to you and put 1 resource token on it from the token bank. Objective - If an investigator enters The Spire of Levana: Advance. (Beware---you may wish to free as many captive souls as you can before advancing the act.)

cards.name: Miles to Go
cards.text:
Tuck each [[Bound]] story asset that has not been removed from the game and is not in an investigator's threat area underneath the act deck. Then, check your campaign log. If the investigators possess the Umbral Katadesmos, Katadesmos of Anima, and Amaranthine Katadesmos weaknesses: Proceed to Scenario Interlude C (Page 45).
If not, and "Mater Tenebrarum's power wanes," "Mater Suspiriorum's power wanes," & "Mater Lachrymarum's power wanes" Proceed to Scenario Interlude B (page 44).
If neither of the above are true: Proceed to Scenario Interlude A (page 43).

cards.name: Sorrow's Approach
cards.text: [action]: Discard each card in your hand. Draw an equal amount of cards. (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
"A solemn wind began to blow, the most mournful 
that ever ear heard. Mournful! That is saying nothing. 
It was a wind that had swept the fields of 
mortality for a hundred centuries."
---Thomas De Quincey, Suspiria de Profundis
cards.name: Sorrow's Approach
Chambers of Memory
cards.text: Forced - When you discover a clue at Chambers of Memory: Take X horror. X is 1 less than the number of clues you have discovered at Chambers of Memory this round.

cards.flavor:
"There is no such thing as forgetting possible 
to the mind; just as the stars seem to withdraw 
before the common light of day... we all know that 
it is the light which is drawn over them as a veil---
and that they are waiting to be revealed."
---Thomas De Quincey, 
Confessions of an English Opium-Eater
cards.name: Chambers of Memory

cards.flavor:
Shadowy figures flit through the corners of this court---
thousands upon thousands of the Sorrows' captive servants.
cards.name: Dark Crossing
cards.text: Jinxed. Forced - At the end of the round, if Dark Crossing has no clues on it: Replenish clues on this location to its maximum clue value. [action]: Choose another investigator at this location. Give that investigator 1 [per_investigator] of your clues.

cards.flavor:
"No death, no doom, no anguish can arouse the surpassing despair which flows from a loss of identity. 
Merging with nothingness is peaceful oblivion; 
but to be aware of existence and yet to know that one is 
no longer a definite being distinguished from other 
beings---that one no longer has a self---that is the 
nameless summit of agony and dread."
---H.P. Lovecraft, Through the Gates of the Silver Key
cards.name: Dark Crossing

cards.flavor:
Long, treacherous shadows stretch across the parlor, but the fire in the massive hearth burns like any other
---a small mercy of warmth amidst the cold elegance.
cards.name: Gallery of Darkness
cards.text: [free] Spend 2 resources: Remove a resource token from a [[Bound]] story asset in play. (Group limit twice per round.)

cards.flavor:
"They wheeled in mazes; I spelled the steps. 
They telegraphed from afar; I read the signals. 
They conspired together; 
and on the mirrors of darkness my eye traced the plots."
---Thomas De Quincey, 
Levana and Our Ladies of Sorrow
cards.name: Gallery of Darkness

cards.flavor: Every nameplate has been rubbed out to the last letter.
cards.name: Hall of Forgotten Faces
cards.text:
Jinxed.
[action][action]: Take 1 mental trauma. Discard all non-weakness treachery cards in your threat area. (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
Shattered statues and crumbling effigies  
of the Sorrows' discarded identities line the 
shadowy walls of this grand hall.
cards.name: Hall of Forgotten Faces
Path of Mankind
cards.text: [action]: Reveal the top 1[per_investigator] cards of the encounter deck, and deal one card to each investigator. In player order, each investigator draws the card dealt to them. Skip the "draw encounter cards" step of the next mythos phase. (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
"Here were the hopes which blossom in the paths of life, reconciled with the peace which is in the grave; motions of the intellect as unwearied as the heavens, yet for all anxieties a halcyon of calm: a tranquillity that seem no product of inertia, but as if resulting from mighty and equal antagonisms; infinite activities, infinite repose."
---Thomas De Quincey, 
Confessions of an English Opium-Eater
cards.name: Path of Mankind
The Court of Sorrows
cards.text:
Jinxed.
The Court of Sorrows gets +1 shroud for each clue on it.
[action][action] If there are no clues on The Court of Sorrows, spend 3 resources: Put 1 [per_investigator] clues on The Court of Sorrows (from the token bank). (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: The Spire of Levana
cards.text: Forced - As an additional cost to enter The Spire of Levana, both of the following conditions must be true: - Maddalena Talenti must be at this location. - Each remaining investigator must be at Subliminal Steps.

cards.name: Parlor of Tears
cards.text:
Jinxed.
This location gets +1 shroud for each [[Bound]] story asset attached to an [[Astral]] location.

cards.flavor:
"Rightly it is said of utter, utter misery, that it 
'cannot be remembered'; itself, being a rememberable thing, is swallowed up in its own chaos."
---Thomas De Quincey, Suspiria de Profundis
cards.name: Parlor of Tears
Flight of Sighs
cards.text:
Jinxed.
[action]: Choose a [[Humanoid]] enemy at Flight of Sighs and test [combat] or [agility] (5). If you succeed, defeat the chosen enemy (if that enemy is [[Elite]], deal 2 damage to it instead.)

cards.flavor:
It's difficult for you to appreciate the beauty of the 
palace's grand staircase. Instead, there's only the dread of knowing what you seek lies somewhere at its top.
cards.name: Flight of Sighs

cards.flavor: Another falling star. Another wish, lost in the void.
cards.name: Stargazing Terrace
cards.text: Forced - Whenever a story asset is placed face down in an investigator's threat area: Put 1 clue on Stargazing Terrace from the token bank.

cards.flavor:
From here, the sky stretches out before you---an achingly beautiful sprawl of shimmering stars adrift in a vast amethyst void, utterly unlike the storm-tossed nightmare you understood the Astral realm to be. 
But to be fair, even after all this, you still don't 
think you understand much about this place at all.
cards.name: Stargazing Terrace
Subliminal Steps
cards.text:
Jinxed.
[reaction] When you enter this location, spend 1 resource: Immediately move to a revealed connecting location. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Subliminal Steps
cards.text: Opening above you, a truly labyrinthine staircase leads toward the upper levels of the palace.

cards.flavor:
But that's them, and not you. 
And you'd never forget a friend, would you?
cards.name: Umbral Oubliette
cards.text:
Jinxed.
[reaction] If this location has no clues or enemies on it, investigators at this location spend 2 [per_investigator] clues as a group: Draw the card underneath this location and put it into play under your control. This card does not take up a slot for the remainder of the scenario.

cards.flavor:
Even the Sorrows have things they'd rather forget. 
This hollow void is where the things 
they deem beneath their notice are left to rot.
cards.name: Umbral Oubliette
The Instigator
cards.text:
That night at the Hotel Seasons, Declan had thought that the world would be at his fingertips, and Ana Giuliano would be there to enjoy it by his side. Now, he’s just another link in this chain of horrors; a ghost bound to the Palace of Sorrows. "Please," his spirit whispers, desperate to escape. "Let me go... let's make a deal, what do you say?" You're not sure what he's asking of you, but is it right to leave him here...?
You must decide (choose one):
Release O'Doyle's spirit. Choose one: - Record in your campaign log that "you took Declan O'Doyle's bargain." Then, remove this card from the game. Or - Put this card in your threat area, face down. While this card is in your threat area, you do not gain resources during the Upkeep phase.
Refuse. Tuck this card beneath the act deck and resume playing.

cards.flavor: It’s been months, but you remember him like it was yesterday: Declan O’Doyle, the O’Bannion gang boss whose murder set off this whole, rotten mess.
cards.name: Declan O'Doyle
The Architect
cards.text:
Varelli lifts his head, blinking up at you with bloodshot, distant eyes. "Are you trapped here too, children?" he murmurs, voice barely a whisper. "My sympathies... There's no escaping this place. I should know; I built these walls with my own hands..." He folds his bony hands in his lap and closes his eyes. "You’re welcome to wait here with me, if you wish. If we’re lucky---if we behave---maybe the Ladies will finally let us die…" You haven’t given up yet. But unless you find a way to convince him you’re ready to face his mistresses, Varelli’s spirit will certainly be lost to despair.
You must decide (choose one):
Release Varelli's spirit. Choose one: - Search each investigator's deck and play area for the Pendant of the Antecedent and exile that card. Then, remove this card from the game. - Put this card in your threat area, face down. While this card is in your threat area, the shroud of your location and all connecting locations is increased by 1.
Refuse. Tuck this card beneath the act deck and resume playing.

cards.flavor: For five centuries, Varelli built grand palaces for the Three Mothers. Now, the frail, skeletal figure you find slumped by the fireplace seems hardly aware of the world around him---discarded until his mistresses have use for him.
cards.name: Elio Varelli
The Doomsayer
cards.text:
The old monk’s spirit rifles through scattered papers with trembling hands. "I don’t know," he mutters, his voice thin and reedy. "Darkness? Tears...? I thought I understood. Why can't I remember? Won’t someone help me remember?"
You must decide (choose one):
Release Brother Ross's spirit. Choose one: - Search each investigator's deck and play area for Triad Figurine and exile that card. Then, remove this card from the game. - Put this card in your threat area, face down. While this card is in your threat area, your base [intellect] is 0.
Refuse. Tuck this card beneath the act deck and resume playing.

cards.flavor:
Brother Ross spent his life writing about the 
mysterious nature of the Three Mothers. In their twisted gratitude, they’ve granted him just what he sought---
the opportunity to unravel all their secrets, 
and an eternity to suffer through every last one.
cards.name: Brother Evan Ross
The Plaything
cards.text:
"Get down! We’re under fire!" Sgt. Mandel cries, cowering away from phantom mortar shells only he can see. It’s only when you hear his strangled shout---"She’s in the trees---she’s killing everyone!"---that you grasp just how deep the horror runs. Mater Suspiriorum has trapped him in his memories, and without help, he’s bound to remain a broken man in a world of invisible terrors.
You must decide (choose one):
Release Sgt. Mandel's spirit. Choose one: - Search each investigator's deck and play area for Frau Perchta's Knife and exile that card. Then, remove this card from the game. - Put this card in your threat area, face down. While this card is in your threat area, your base [combat] is 0.
Refuse. Tuck this card beneath the act deck and resume playing.

cards.flavor: Although Sgt. Mandel's physical body still languishes in a dark corner of the Arkham Sanatorium, his spirit has spent the better part of the last decade reliving the horrors of the great war for Mater Suspiriorum's amusement.
cards.name: Sgt. Frank Mandel
The Sacrifice
cards.text:
"...I am pain. I am nothing but a wound. I am nothing at all..." Daria's fragile spirit sobs in anguish as she endlessly relives the pain of her death. To prevent Mater Suspiriorum from profiting further from the poor dancer's suffering, a reminder of who she truly is might pull her from this torture---or perhaps you could offer yourself up in her place, instead.
You must decide (choose one):
Release's Daria's spirit. Choose One: - Search each investigator's deck and play area for the Glass Peacock and exile that card. Then, remove this card from the game. - Put Daria Argent in your threat area, face down. While this card is in your threat area, your maximum health is reduced by 2.
Refuse. Tuck this card beneath the act deck and resume playing.

cards.flavor:
Many talented young students lost their lives the 
night that Nussbaum Academy went up in flames. 
Daria had been the first: An offering to Mater Suspiriorum beneath Madame Pappenheimer's blade.
cards.name: Daria Argent
The Scion
cards.text:
As de Castries’ spirit scribbles feverishly in his book, you leaf through some of his other recent writings, finding most have devolved into cloying, amateurish stabs at romance poetry. "I dwelt alone / In a world of moan / And my soul was a stagnant tide / Till the Lady of Darkness came to me / And stood at my side." It is absolute drivel. There is something poetic, in a way, about the once-great writer condemned to an eternity of churning out rubbish, but you’re not so sure it's a fate he deserves.
You must decide (choose one):
Release de Castries' spirit. Choose one: - Search each investigator's deck and play area for De Castries' Grand Cipher and exile that card. Then, remove this card from the game. - Put this card in your threat area face down and seal the two non-symbol tokens in the chaos bag with the highest modifiers on it for the remainder of the scenario.
Refuse. Tuck this card beneath the act deck and resume playing.

cards.flavor:
Few in all history were as favored by Mater Tenebrarum as the writer Thibaut de Castries, whose life was one 
of fame and decadent success. And now, he is forced to demonstrate his gratitude eternally, filling page after 
page with devotions to the Mother of Darkness.
cards.name: Thibaut de Castries
The Vessel
cards.text:
The meaning behind that quiet dignity soon becomes clear---frayed and worn from years of use as Mater Lachrymarum’s body, Giuliano's voice has been stolen from her. She regards you with cold and hollow eyes that implore you: leave while you still can, lest you join the endless list of the Three Mothers’ conquests. You wonder if there’s any way to free her from this eternal bondage. Something that could prove the depth of your resolve.
You must decide (choose one):
Release Ana's spirit. Choose one: - Search each investigator's deck and play area for I Vespri Siciliani and exile that card. Then, remove this card from the game. - Put this card in your threat area, face down. While this card is in your threat area, you must spend 1 action to play Fast cards.
Refuse. Tuck this card beneath the act deck and resume playing.

cards.flavor: The real Ana Giuliano; the austere Italian woman Mater Lachrymarum wore as her host over forty years ago, not the grande dame you met at the Hotel Seasons. Even now,  bound to the Palace of Sorrows until the end of time, there's a quiet dignity to her as she endures her fate.
cards.name: Mamma Giuliano
The Witch
cards.text:
"Please," the old woman's spirit whispers, "I’m so tired... all this work, neverending... If I can just find my missing hand, My Lady will let me rest..." Her eyes glint with a strange gleam as she adds, "Or perhaps... you'd lend me yours? Take pity on an old soul..."
You must decide (choose one):
Release Elizabeth's spirit. Choose one: - Search each investigator's deck and play area for The Hand of the Hag and exile that card. Then, remove this card from the game. - Put this card in your threat area, face down. While this card is in your threat area, you have 1 fewer hand slot.
Refuse. Tuck this card beneath the act deck and resume playing.

cards.flavor:
In life, Elizabeth was the proprietress of Arkham's Three Conies Inn, and a beloved daughter of Mater Tenebrarum. In death, her reward is simple: she's earned the privilege 
to toil at her mistress's feet until the end of time.
cards.name: Elizabeth Salmon
Maddalena Talenti
cards.text: Investigators at Maddalena Talenti's location get +1 to all skill tests. Forced - At the end of the round, move Maddalena Talenti one location toward The Spire of Levana. Each investigator not at Maddalena Talenti's location or a connecting location takes 1 horror.

cards.name: Daughter of Sorrows
cards.text: Jinxed. Hunter. Revelation - Put 1 doom on Daughter of Sorrows. Forced - When Daughter of Sorrows attacks you: The nearest enemy [[Witch]] other than Daughter of Sorrows also attacks you, regardless of her location.

cards.name: Lady of Anguish
cards.text: Aloof. Elusive. Spawn - Empty Location. Forced - If you take a fight or investigate at action this card's location or a connecting location and Lady of Anguish is ready: Lady of Anguish immediately moves to your location and engages you.

cards.flavor: The time to stand against the Three Mothers has come. All your preparations and planning have built to this moment. But when you replay Maddalena's swift undoing in your mind, your resolve falters---if they could do that to her, what hope do you have?
cards.name: The Succession of Witches
cards.text: Forced - If you would deal any amount of damage to one of the [[Three Mothers]], choose one instead: Either reveal an equal amount of chaos tokens from the chaos bag and choose a non-[auto_fail] token to seal on her, or exhaust her. Jinx -- Find which of the [[Three Mothers]] has the most tokens sealed on her. Either return one of those tokens to the chaos bag, or she immediately attacks you. Objective - If all of the following are true, advance: - Mater Tenebrarum has 1 [per_investigator] [cultist] tokens sealed on her. - Mater Suspiriorum has 1 [per_investigator] [tablet] tokens sealed on her. - Mater Lachrymarum has 1 [per_investigator] [elder_thing] tokens sealed on her.

cards.name: Maybe You're a Lion
cards.text:
The regal weight of the Sorrows' command, the air of untouchable authority---it's begun to crack under the pressure of your perseverance. You can feel the shift in the room. Maybe their power isn’t infinite. Now, with their spells unraveled and their tempers worn raw, the truth of them is plain to see. They’re tired.
Exhaust each of the [[Three Mothers]].

cards.flavor:
And here you stand. 
The child we once called darling. 
You, who we led astray, who we beguiled.
Ours were the symbols, yours were the words.
And now, you know elder truths, grand truths, fearful truths. 
Now, you see the things that ought not to be seen. 
And so shall our commission be finally accomplished---
that we plagued your heart until 
we have unfolded the capacities of your spirit.
How proud of you we are.
cards.name: Your Ladies of Sorrow
cards.text: Forced - Each of the [[Three Mothers]] loses aloof and gains hunter. Each of the [[Three Mothers]] has X total health instead of ?. X is the number of cards tucked beneath the act deck. Jinx -- Ready the nearest of the [[Three Mothers.]] If she is at your location, she attacks you. Objective - If all [[Three Mothers]] are in the victory display, advance.

cards.name: Dominae Dolorosae
cards.text:
Against all odds, the Three Mothers lie dying, their forms flickering like candles against the floor of the Court of Sorrows. What’s strange---what’s wrong---is the quiet grace in their defeat. "You have flown," they say, their three voices joined in unison. "When you could have broken. Persevered, when failure was all but assured. What a joy, to see our child proven within the crucible. How you do gleam." Gripped with frustration and confusion, you demand the dying witches explain themselves. After all this, all the pain they've left in their wake---they dare to feel pride? In you? But of course, there is no explanation. The Three Mothers are cryptic to the last, as they blink out of existence like dying stars, one by one. "Until next we meet."
→R1.

cards.name: The Seat of Sacrifice
cards.text: [reaction] When you reveal a [bless] or [curse] token during a test at this location: Treat that token as a 0, return it to the token pool, and discard a random card from your hand. [action]: Investigate. This test's difficulty is equal to the amount of doom on the agenda + X, where X is half of the number of cards tucked underneath the act deck (rounded up). If you succeed, reveal a number of tokens from the chaos bag equal to the amount you succeeded by and choose a non-[auto_fail] token to seal on Mater Lachrymarum. You may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues to automatically succeed by 2 at this test.

cards.flavor:
"She it is that night and day raves and moans, 
calling for vanished faces... By the power of her keys 
it is that Our Lady of Tears glides a ghostly 
intruder into the chambers of sleepless men."
---Thomas de Quincy, Levana and Our Ladies of Sorrow
cards.name: The Seat of Sacrifice
The Seat of Shadows
cards.text: [reaction] When you reveal a [curse] token during a test at this location: Treat that token as a –1, and return it to the token pool. [action]: Fight. This test's difficulty is equal to this location's shroud + X, where X is half of the number of cards tucked underneath the act deck (rounded up). If you succeed, reveal a number of tokens from the chaos bag equal to the amount you succeeded by and choose a non-[auto_fail] token to seal on Mater Tenebrarum. You may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues to automatically succeed by 2 at this test.

cards.flavor:
"Her kingdom is not large, or else no flesh should live; 
but within that kingdom all power is hers. She is the 
defier of God. She also is the mother of lunacies, 
and the suggestress of suicides."
---Thomas de Quincy, Levana and Our Ladies of Sorrow
cards.name: The Seat of Shadows
The Seat of Silence
cards.text: [reaction] When you reveal a [bless] token during a test at this location: Treat that token as a –2, and return it to the token pool. [action]: Evade. This test's difficulty is equal to the number of chaos tokens on Mater Suspiriorum + X, where X is half of the number of cards tucked underneath the act deck (rounded up). If you succeed, reveal a number of tokens from the chaos bag equal to the amount you succeeded by and choose a non-[auto_fail] token to seal on Mater Suspiriorum. You may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues to automatically succeed by 2 at this test.

cards.flavor:
"She never scales the clouds, nor walks abroad upon the winds... And her eyes, if they were ever seen, would be neither sweet nor subtle; they would be found filled with perishing dreams, and with wrecks of forgotten delirium."
---Thomas de Quincy, Levana and Our Ladies of Sorrow
cards.name: The Seat of Silence
Mater Lachrymarum
cards.text: Aloof. Jinxed. Forced - When a [bless] or [curse] is sealed here: Release it and take 1 damage and 1 horror. Forced - At the beginning of the enemy phase, if there are any [tablet] or [cultist] tokens sealed here: Mater Lachrymarum immediately attacks the investigator with the lowest [willpower], regardless of her location.
cards.traits: Ancient One. Three Mothers. Witch. Elite.

cards.name: Mater Suspiriorum
cards.text: Aloof. Jinxed. Forced - When a [bless] or [curse] is sealed here: Release it and take 1 horror. Forced - At the beginning of the enemy phase, if there are any [elder_thing] or [cultist] tokens sealed here: Mater Suspiriorum immediately attacks the investigator with the lowest [agility], regardless of her location.
cards.traits: Ancient One. Three Mothers. Witch. Elite.

cards.name: Mater Tenebrarum
